text:
ID: 24
Title: Add Player to ID Based Bossbar
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(add|set) bossbar %string% for %player% 
(add|give) %player% [to] bossbar %string%
Description:
Add a player to an ID based Bossbar.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 25
Title: Add/Remove Players from Group Scores
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
add %player% to group score [with id] %string%
(delete|remove) %player% from group [id based] score %string%
Description:
Add or removed a players group based score. 

For more details on how to use the skRayFall Scoreboard/Sidebar system, a tutorial can be found here (https://skripthub.net/tutorials/19).
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 26
Title: Add/Set Bossbar Flag
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(add|set) [a] [the] flag %BossBarFlag% to [the] bossbar %string%
Description:
Add a flag to a ID based Bossbar.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 27
Title: Animated Ball Effect
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(spawn|create|apply) (a|the|an) animated ball (effect|formation) (at|on|for|to) %entity/location% with id %string% [with particle %particles%] [offset by %number%, %number%(,| and) %number%]
Description:
Creates an EffectLib animated ball effect.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 28
Title: Atom Effect
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(spawn|create|apply) (a|the|an) atom (effect|formation) (at|on|for|to) %entity/location% with id %string%
Description:
Creates an EffectLib atom effect.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 29
Title: Bind Hologram
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
bind hologram %string% to %living entities% for %timespan% [offset by %number%, %number%( and|,) %number%]
Description:
Bind Hologram by:
* Entity
* Timespan
* Offset x, y & z

Create floating text that follows an entity
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Holographic Displays', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/holographic-displays'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 30
Title: Bleed Effect
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(spawn|create|apply) (a|the|an) bleed (effect|formation) (at|on|for|to) %entity/location% with id %string%
Description:
Creates an EffectLib bleed effect.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 31
Title: Change Citizen Skin
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
change citizen %number% skin to %string%
Description:
Change the skin of a citizen by:
* ID
* Minecraft Username

This will change the skin of an NPC to a given Minecraft username
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 32
Title: Circle Effect
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(spawn|create|apply) (a|the|an) circle (effect|formation) (at|on|for) %entity/location% with id %string% [with particle[s] %particles%] [(and|with) radius %number%]
Description:
Creates an EffectLib circle effect.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 33
Title: Citizen Build
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
make citizen %number% build %string% at %location% [speed %number%] for %player%
Description:
Build by:
* Schematic
* Player
* Location
* Citizen ID

This will have an NPC build a schematic that is located in plugins/Builder/schematics
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Builder', 'link': 'http://ci.citizensnpcs.co/job/Builder/'}, {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 34
Title: Citizen Hold
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
make citizen %number% hold %item stack%
Description:
This will make a Citizen hold an object in their hand.
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 35
Title: Citizen Invulnerability
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
make citizen %number% (invulnerable|vulnerable)
Description:
Change if a citizen takes damage by:
* ID
* Invulnerable
* Vulnerable

This will allow you to choose if an NPC can receive damage
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 36
Title: Citizen Look Targeting
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
make citizen %number% look at %location%
Description:
Change the view of a citizen by:
* ID
* Location

Pick a location for an NPC to look at
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 37
Title: Citizen Max Health
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(set|make) citizen[s] %number% max health [to] %number%
Description:
Modify citizens max health by:
* ID
* Number

Will allow you to modify the maximum amount of health an NPC can have. 0.5 = half a heart, 1 = a heart, etc...
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 38
Title: Citizen Nametag Visibility
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(set|make) citizen[s] %number% nametag (invisible|visible)
Description:
Modify citizen nametags by:
* ID
* Invisibility
* Visibility

For if you want to toggle the visibility of names above the NPC's head
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 39
Title: Citizens Look Close Trait
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
give npc %number% the look close trait
Description:
Allow citizens to look at the closest player automatically. This effect is toggleable, so to disable this trait for a citizen run this effect again.
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 40
Title: Create Citizen
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
create [a] citizen named %string% (at|%direction%) %location% [as (a|an) %entitytypes%]
Description:
Create citizens with:
* Name
* Direction
* Location
* Entity Type

This will place an NPC in your world that can be modified
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 41
Title: Create Dynamic Object Based Holograms
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
create bound holo object %string% with id %string% to %entity% [offset by %number%, %number%( and|,) %number%]
Description:
Create dynamic holograms that can be bound to entity's through an id based system.
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Holographic Displays', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/holographic-displays'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 42
Title: Create Group Based Score
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(set|create) group id [based] score %string% in sidebar for %player% to %number% with id %string%
Description:
Create a group ID based score and assign it to a player or multiple players.

For more details on how to use the skRayFall Scoreboard/Sidebar system, a tutorial can be found here (https://skripthub.net/tutorials/19).
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 43
Title: Create Hologram
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
create hologram %string% at %location% for %timespan%
display hologram %string% at %location% to %player% for %timespan%
Description:
[NOTE] Client-side holograms require ProtocolLib

Set hologram by:
* Text
* Lines
* Floating Item
* Timespan
* Location
* Clientside

Create floating text at a location
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Holographic Displays', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/holographic-displays'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 44
Title: Create ID based Bossbar
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
create (bossbar|boss bar) title[d] %string% and id %string% for %players% [with (value|progress) %number%] [with colors %BossBarColor%] [with style %BossBarStyle%] [with flags %BossBarFlag%]
Description:
Create a ID based Bossbar for a group of people.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 45
Title: Create Particles
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(create|display|show) %number% [of] %EffectLibParticle% particle[s] at %location% [(with data of %itemstack%|with color %number%, %number%(,| and) %number%)] [offset by %number%, %number%(,| and) %number%] [(with|at) speed %number%]
(create|display|show) %number% [of] %EffectLibParticle% particle[s] at %location% for %player% [with data of %itemstack%] [offset by %number%, %number%(,| and) %number%] [(with|at) speed %number%]
Description:
This has been deprecated, please use Skript's built in particle system.

skRayFall's new particle system powered by EffectLib. Color's and ItemStacks can only be assigned to certain EffectLibParticle types. Please see this (https://gist.github.com/eyesniper2/07f5c0955af05c0782ad) list for the details of which effects are supported.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 46
Title: Create Static Object Based Holograms
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
create holo object %string% with id  %string% at %location%
create client side holo object %string% with id %string% at %location% to %player%
create interactive holo object %string% with id %string% at %location%
create interactive client side holo object %string% with id %string% at %location% to %player%
Description:
Create non moving object based holograms! Use the interactive versions if you want to take advantage of the touch and pickup events!

Client side holograms are also possible with the second syntax but will also require protocollib.
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Protocollib', 'link': 'https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/protocollib.1997/'}, {'name': 'Holographic Displays', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/holographic-displays'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 47
Title: Delete Boss Bar
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
delete bossbar of %player%
Description:
Delete the boss bar of a player
Required Plugins: {'name': 'BossBarAPI', 'link': 'https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/api-bossbarapi-1-7-1-8-1-9-1-10.7504/'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 48
Title: Delete Group Score
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(delete|remove) score[s] [with] group id %string%
Description:
Deletes a group score.

For more details on how to use the skRayFall Scoreboard/Sidebar system, a tutorial can be found here (https://skripthub.net/tutorials/19).
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 49
Title: Delete hologram line
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(delete|remove) line %number% in holo object %string%
Description:
Delete a single line in a object based hologram.
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Holographic Displays', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/holographic-displays'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 50
Title: Delete ID based Bossbar
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(remove|destroy) bossbar %string%
Description:
Delete/destroy an ID based Bossbar.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 51
Title: Delete ID based score
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(delete|remove) score [with] id %string%
Description:
Delete an ID based score from a scoreboard.

For more details on how to use the skRayFall Scoreboard/Sidebar system, a tutorial can be found here (https://skripthub.net/tutorials/19).
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 52
Title: Delete Object Based Holograms
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
delete holo object %string%
Description:
Delete object based holograms by id.
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Holographic Displays', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/holographic-displays'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 53
Title: Delete Sidebar Score
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
delete score %string% in sidebar of %player%
Description:
Delete a sidebar score by:
* Name
* Player

This will delete a specified score from a specified player.

For more details on how to use the skRayFall Scoreboard/Sidebar system, a tutorial can be found here (https://skripthub.net/tutorials/19).
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 54
Title: Delete/Stop Effect
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(delete|stop) (effect|formation) %string%
Description:
Stop's a EffectLib effect that matches the id value.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 55
Title: Despawn Citizen
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
despawn citizen %number%
Description:
Despawn citizens by:
* ID

Unlike delete a citizen this will just kill the NPC you can respawn it back at the created location with the respawn citizen effect
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 56
Title: Edit ID based score
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(edit|update) score [with] id %string% to %string% and %number%
Description:
Edit an ID based score.

For more details on how to use the skRayFall Scoreboard/Sidebar system, a tutorial can be found here (https://skripthub.net/tutorials/19).
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 57
Title: Edit Object Based Holograms
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
edit holo object %string% to %string%  [and set interactivity to %boolean%]
edit holo object %string% [with] line [number] %number% to %string% [and set interactivity to %boolean%]
Description:
Edit object based holograms. The first string is the id of the hologram to be changed and the second string is the new content of the hologram. By default the interactivity is false.
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Holographic Displays', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/holographic-displays'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 58
Title: Equip Citizen
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(equip|give) citizen %number% with [an] %itemstack%
Description:
Give citizens:
* Tools
* Armo(u)r

Give citizens things to hold in their hands and wear
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 59
Title: Fake Lightning (No Sound)
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(create|strike) (fake|ultra|no sound) fake lightning at %location%
Description:
Creates a silent fake lightning strike at a location.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 60
Title: Hide BossBar
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
hide bossbar %string%
Description:
Hide a ID based Bossbar.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 61
Title: Line Effect
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(spawn|create|apply) (a|the|an) line (effect|formation) from %entity/location% to %entity/location% with id %string% [with particle[s] %particles%]
Description:
Creates a EffectLib line effect.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 62
Title: Make Citizen Attack
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
make citizen %number% (attack|fight) %living entities%
Description:
Make citizens attack with:
* ID
* Mobs
* Players

Makes a citizen attack a living entity. The entity must be close enough to the NPC
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 63
Title: Make Citizen Talk
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
make citizen %number% (say|communicate) %string% to %livingentities%
Description:
Make citizens communicate with:
* ID
* Messages
* Players

This will make an NPC speak to a player with a custom message
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 64
Title: Max Health
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
set rf max[imum] h(ealth|p) of %entity% to %number%
Description:
Set max health by:
* Entity
* Value

This will change the maximum health of an entity
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 65
Title: Move Citizen
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
move citizen %number% to %location% [at speed %number%]
Description:
Move citizens by:
* ID
* Location
* Speed

This will make a given NPC pathfind to a location
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 66
Title: Place CrackShot Mine
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(place|set|spawn) mine at %location% for %player% as %string%
Description:
Set a CrackShot mine at a location for a player. The string is the weapons name that will be responsible for the damage.
Required Plugins: {'name': 'CrackShot', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/crackshot'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 67
Title: Play Resource Pack Sound
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
play (resource|[custom ]sound) [sound] pack %string% to %player% [at %location%] [(and|with) volume %number%] [(and|with) pitch %number%]
Description:
Play a sound from a resource pack.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 68
Title: Play Sound
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
play %string% to %player% [at volume %number%]
Description:
Play sound by:
* Player
* Client
* Volume

This will play a sound to a player and nobody else

If you want a list of skRayFall sounds go https://hub.spigotmc.org/javadocs/spigot/ click ctrl + f and type 'sound' then press the down arrow once and then click the sound that is shown in green text and that will list all the sounds for you
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 69
Title: Players Tab Name
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
set %player%['s] tab name to %string%
Description:
Lets you customize a players name within the tab menu.

Please note the ['s] was added as of 1.9.18.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 70
Title: Protect Player
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
set citizen number to protect %player%
Description:
Protect by:
* Player
* Citizen ID

This will have a citizen follow a specified player and protect them
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}, {'name': 'Sentry addon for Citizens', 'link': 'http://ci.citizensnpcs.co/job/Sentry/'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 71
Title: Remove Citizen
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(remove|destroy) citizen %number%
Description:
Remove citizens by:
* ID

This will permanently remove a citizen
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 72
Title: Remove Player from BossBar
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
remove %players% [from] bossbar %string%
Description:
Remove a player from a ID based Bossbar.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 73
Title: Remove/Delete Bossbar Flag
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(remove|delete) [a] [the] flag %BossBarFlag% [to] [from] [the] bossbar %string%
Description:
Remove a flag from a ID based Bossbar.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 74
Title: Respawn Citizen
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
respawn citizen %number% (at|%direction%) %location%
Description:
Respawn citizens by:
* ID
* Direction
* Location

This will force an NPC to come back to life if it was previously killed or despawned by the despawn citizen effect. This will not work if the citizen is already alive so it can't be used to duplicate citizens
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Citizens', 'link': 'https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/citizens'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 75
Title: Send Title
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
send %player% title %string% [with subtitle %string%] [for %timespan%] [with %timespan% fade in and %timespan% fade out]
Description:
Set title by:
* Name
* Subtitle
* Player
* Time
* Fadein
* Fadeout

This will send a title to a player with an optional subtitle and display time
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 76
Title: Set Action Bar
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
set action bar of %player% to %string%
set %player%['s] action bar to %string%
Description:
Display Action Bar by:
* Player
* Text

This will display text above the player's hotbar for a few seconds. This is like the text you receive when changing the item in your hand
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 77
Title: Set Below Name Score
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
set score %string% below %player% to %number% for %player%
Description:
Set score of a sidebar by:
* Name
* Value
* Player
* Target

This will change the name and score below a player's name
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 78
Title: Set Boss Bar
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
set bossbar named %string% for %player% to %number%
display bossbar with %string% to %player% for %timespan%
Description:
Set a timed or static bossbar.
Required Plugins: {'name': 'BossBarAPI', 'link': 'https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/api-bossbarapi-1-7-1-8-1-9-1-10.7504/'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 79
Title: Set Bossbar Color
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(set|edit) bossbar %string% colo[u]r to %BossBarColor%
Description:
Set the color of an ID based Bossbar.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 80
Title: Set Bossbar Progress/Value
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(set|edit) bossbar %string% (value|progress) to %number%
Description:
Set the progress of an ID based bossbar.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 81
Title: Set Bossbar Style
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(set|edit) bossbar %string% style to %BossBarStyle%
Description:
Set the style of an ID based Bossbar.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 82
Title: Set Bossbar Title/Name
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(set|edit) bossbar %string% (title|name) to %string%
Description:
Set the name of an ID based Bossbar.
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 83
Title: Set Cape
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
make %player% wear cape %itemstack%
Description:
Give the player a cape. The Item stack in this effect MUST be a banner.
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Capes', 'link': 'https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/capes.9068/'}
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 84
Title: Set ID based Score
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall
Syntax Pattern:
(set|create) id [based] score %string% in sidebar of %player% to %number% with id %string%
Description:
Make an ID based score in a players scoreboard. This method is ideal for creating complex text based scoreboards.

For more details on how to use the skRayFall Scoreboard/Sidebar system, a tutorial can be found here (https://skripthub.net/tutorials/19).
Addon Link: https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/skrayfall

ID: 85
Title: Set Sidebar Name
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skRayFall

Title: Last Spawned Entity
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [last[ly]] (spawned|shot) %*entitydata%
[the] [last[ly]] dropped (item)
[the] [last[ly]] (created|struck) (lightning)
[the] [last[ly]] (launched|deployed) (firework)
Description:
Holds the entity that was spawned most recently with the spawn effect (section), dropped with the drop effect, shot with the shoot effect or created with the lightning effect. Please note that even though you can spawn multiple mobs simultaneously (e.g. with 'spawn 5 creepers'), only the last spawned mob is saved and can be used. If you spawn an entity, shoot a projectile and drop an item you can however access all them together.
Return Type: Entity
Compatible Addon Version: 1.3 (spawned entity), 2.0 (shot entity), 2.2-dev26 (dropped item), 2.7 (struck lightning, firework)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 878
Title: Drops
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:

Description:
This expression only works in death and harvest events.
In a death event, will hold the drops of the dying creature.
Drops can be prevented by removing them with "remove ... from drops", e.g. "remove all pickaxes from the drops", or "clear drops" if you don't want any drops at all.
Return Type: Item Type
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 889
Title: Argument
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] last arg[ument]
[the] arg[ument](-| )<(\d+)>
[the] <(\d*1)st|(\d*2)nd|(\d*3)rd|(\d*[4-90])th> arg[ument][s]
[(all [[of] the]|the)] arg[ument][(s)]
[the] %*classinfo%( |-)arg[ument][( |-)<\d+>]
[the] arg[ument]( |-)%*classinfo%[( |-)<\d+>]
Description:
Usable in script commands and command events. Holds the value of an argument given to the command, e.g. if the command "/tell <player> <text>" is used like "/tell Njol Hello Njol!" argument 1 is the player named "Njol" and argument 2 is "Hello Njol!".
One can also use the type of the argument instead of its index to address the argument, e.g. in the above example 'player-argument' is the same as 'argument 1'.
Please note that specifying the argument type is only supported in script commands.
Return Type: Object
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.7 (support for command events)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 901
Title: Parse
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
%string% parsed as (%*classinfo%|"<.*>")
Description:
Parses text as a given type, or as a given pattern.
This expression can be used in two different ways: One which parses the entire text as a single instance of a type, e.g. as a number, and one that parses the text according to a pattern.
If the given text could not be parsed, this expression will return nothing and the parse error will be set if some information is available.
Some notes about parsing with a pattern:
- The pattern must be a Skript pattern, e.g. percent signs are used to define where to parse which types, e.g. put a %number% or %items% in the pattern if you expect a number or some items there.
- You have to save the expression's value in a list variable, e.g. set {parsed::*} to message parsed as "...".
- The list variable will contain the parsed values from all %types% in the pattern in order. If a type was plural, e.g. %items%, the variable's value at the respective index will be a list variable, e.g. the values will be stored in {parsed::1::*}, not {parsed::1}.
Return Type: Object
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 903

Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[%number% [(block|met(er|re))[s]] [to the]] (north[(-| |)(east|west)][(ward(s|ly|)|er(n|ly|))] [of]|south[(-| |)(east|west)][(ward(s|ly|)|er(n|ly|))] [of]|(east|west)[(ward(s|ly|)|er(n|ly|))] [of]|above|over|(up|down)[ward(s|ly|)]|below|under[neath]|beneath) [%direction%]
[%number% [(block|met(er|re))[s]]] in [the] (direction|horizontal direction|facing|horizontal facing) of %entity/block% (of|from|)
[%number% [(block|met(er|re))[s]]] in %entity/block%'[s] (direction|horizontal direction|facing|horizontal facing) (of|from|)
[%number% [(block|met(er|re))[s]]] (in[ ]front [of]|forward[s]|behind|backwards|[to the] (right|left) [of])
[%number% [(block|met(er|re))[s]]] horizontal[ly] (in[ ]front [of]|forward[s]|behind|backwards|to the (right|left) [of])
Description:
A helper expression for the direction type.
Return Type: Direction
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0 (basic), 2.0 (extended)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 904
Title: Numbers
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[(all [[of] the]|the)] (numbers|integers|decimals) (between|from) %number% (and|to) %number%
Description:
All numbers between two given numbers, useful for looping.
Use 'numbers' if your start is not an integer and you want to keep the fractional part of the start number constant, or use 'integers' if you only want to loop integers.
You may also use 'decimals' if you want to use the decimal precision of the start number.
You may want to use the 'times' expression instead, for instance 'loop 5 times:'
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.4.6 (integers & numbers), 2.5.1 (decimals)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 905
Title: Random Numbers
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[a|%integer%] random (integer|number)[s] (from|between) %number% (to|and) %number%
Description:
A given amount of random numbers or integers between two given numbers. Use 'number' if you want any number with decimal parts, or use use 'integer' if you only want whole numbers.
Please note that the order of the numbers doesn't matter, i.e. random number between 2 and 1 will work as well as random number between 1 and 2.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.4, 2.10 (Multiple random numbers)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Extracts part of a text. You can either get the first <x> characters, the last <x> characters, the character at index <x>, or the characters between indices <x> and <y>. The indices <x> and <y> should be between 1 and the length of the text (other values will be fit into this range).

ID: 927
Title: Bed
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [((safe|valid)|(unsafe|invalid))] bed[s] [location[s]] of %offlineplayers%

Description:
Returns the bed location of a player, i.e. the spawn point of a player if they ever slept in a bed and the bed still exists and is unobstructed however, you can set the unsafe bed location of players and they will respawn there even if it has been obstructed or doesn't exist anymore and that's the default behavior of this expression otherwise you will need to be specific i.e. safe bed location.

NOTE: Offline players can not have their bed location changed, only online players.

Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Converts date to human-readable text format. By default, 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss z' (e.g. '2018-03-30 16:03:12 +01') will be used. For reference, see this Wikipedia article.

ID: 931
Title: Time
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] time[s] [([with]in|of) %worlds%]
%worlds%'[s] time[s]
Description:
The time of a world.
Use the "minecraft timespan" syntax to change the time according to Minecraft's time intervals.
Since Minecraft uses discrete intervals for time (ticks), changing the time by real-world minutes or real-world seconds only changes it approximately.
Removing an amount of time from a world's time will move the clock forward a day.
Return Type: Time
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 932
Title: Biome
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] biome [(of|%direction%) %locations%]
%locations%'[s] biome
Description:
The biome at a certain location. Please note that biomes are only defined for x/z-columns
(i.e. the altitude (y-coordinate) doesn't matter), up until Minecraft 1.15.x.
As of Minecraft 1.16, biomes are now 3D (per block vs column).
Return Type: Biome
Compatible Addon Version: 1.4.4, 2.6.1 (3D biomes)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 933
Title: Target
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] target[[ed] %*entitydata%] [of %livingentities%] [ignoring blocks] [[with|at] [a] ray[ ]size [of] %number%]
%livingentities%'[s] target[[ed] %*entitydata%] [ignoring blocks] [[with|at] [a] ray[ ]size [of] %number%]
Description:
For players this is the entity at the crosshair.
For mobs and experience orbs this is the entity they are attacking/following (if any).
The 'ray size' and 'ignoring blocks' options are only valid for players' targets.
The 'ray size' option effectively increases the area around the crosshair an entity can be in. It does so by expanding the hitboxes of entities by the given amount. Display entities have a hit box of 0, so using the 'ray size' option can be helpful when targeting them.
May grab entities in unloaded chunks.
Return Type: Entity
Compatible Addon Version: 1.4.2, 2.7 (Reset), 2.8.0 (ignore blocks, ray size)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 934
Title: Yaw / Pitch
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] (yaw|pitch) of %entities/locations/vectors%
%entities/locations/vectors%'[s] (yaw|pitch)
Description:
The yaw or pitch of a location or vector.
A yaw of 0 or 360 represents the positive z direction. Adding a positive number to the yaw of a player will rotate it clockwise.
A pitch of 90 represents the negative y direction, or downward facing. A pitch of -90 represents upward facing. Adding a positive number to the pitch will rotate the direction downwards.
Only Paper 1.19+ users may directly change the yaw/pitch of players.
Return Type: float
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0, 2.2-dev28 (vector yaw/pitch), 2.9.0 (entity changers)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

[a] random element [out] of %objects%

Description:
The player's progress in reaching the next level, this represents the experience bar in the game. Please note that this value is between 0 and 1 (e.g. 0.5 = half experience bar).
Changing this value can cause the player's level to change if the resulting level progess is negative or larger than 1, e.g. increase the player's level progress by 0.5 will make the player gain a level if their progress was more than 50%.

Compatible Addon Version: 2.0

ID: 945

Description:
The color of an item, entity, block, firework effect, or text display.
This can also be used to color chat messages with "<%color of ...%>this text is colored!".
Do note that firework effects support setting, adding, removing, resetting, and deleting; text displays support setting and resetting; and items, entities, and blocks only support setting, and only for very few items/blocks.

A player's walking or flying speed. Both can be changed, but values must be between -1 and 1 (excessive values will be changed to -1 or 1 respectively). Negative values reverse directions.
Please note that changing a player's speed will change their FOV just like potions do.

ID: 951
Title: Hash
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
%strings% hash[ed] with ((MD5|SHA-256|SHA-384|SHA-512))
Description:
Hashes the given text using the MD5 or SHA algorithms. Each algorithm is suitable for different use cases.
These hashing algorithms are not suitable for hashing passwords.
If handling passwords, use a hashing algorithm specifically designed for passwords.
MD5 is deprecated and may be removed in a future release. It is provided mostly for backwards compatibility, as it is outdated and not secure. 
SHA is more secure, but is not suitable for hashing passwords (even with salting). 
When hashing data, you must specify algorithms that will be used for security reasons! 
Please note that a hash cannot be reversed under normal circumstances. You will not be able to get original value from a hash with Skript.
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0, 2.2-dev32 (SHA-256 algorithm), 2.12 (SHA-384, SHA-512)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Description:
Equipment of living entities, i.e. the boots, leggings, chestplate or helmet.
Body armor is a special slot that can only be used for:

- Horses: Horse armour (doesn't work on zombie or skeleton horses)
- Wolves: Wolf Armor
- Llamas (regular or trader): Carpet
- Happy Ghasts: Harness

Saddle is a special slot that can only be used for: pigs, striders and horse types (horse, camel, llama, mule, donkey).
Return Type: Slot
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.8.0 (armor), 2.10 (body armor), 2.12 (saddle) 2.12.1 (happy ghast)

Description:
Represents the value of an expression before an event happened or the value it will have directly after the event, e.g. the old or new level respectively in a level change event.
Note: The past, future and present states of an expression are sometimes called 'time states' of an expression.
Note 2: If you don't specify whether to use the past or future state of an expression that has different values, its default value will be used which is usually the value after the event.

ID: 985

Converts given date to Unix timestamp. This is roughly how many seconds have elapsed since 1 January 1970.

ID: 986

ID: 991
Title: Entities
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[(all [[of] the]|the)] %*entitydatas% [(in|of) (world[s] %worlds%|%worlds/chunks%)]
[(all [[of] the]|the)] entities of type[s] %entitydatas% [(in|of) (world[s] %worlds%|%worlds/chunks%)]
[(all [[of] the]|the)] %*entitydatas% (within|[with]in radius) %number% [(block[s]|met(er|re)[s])] (of|around) %location%
[(all [[of] the]|the)] entities of type[s] %entitydatas% in radius %number% (of|around) %location%
[(all [[of] the]|the)] %*entitydatas% within %location% and %location%
[(all [[of] the]|the)] entities of type[s] %entitydatas% within %location% and %location%
Description:
All entities in all worlds, in a specific world, in a chunk, in a radius around a certain location or within two locations. e.g. all players, all creepers in the player's world, or players in radius 100 of the player.

Compatible Addon Version: 1.2.1, 2.5 (chunks), 2.10 (within)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

%object%[ ]^[ ]%object%

ID: 993

Addon: Skript

[the] [event-]<.+>

The entity involved in an event (an entity is a player, a creature or an inanimate object like ignited TNT, a dropped item or an arrow).
You can use the specific type of the entity that's involved in the event, e.g. in a 'death of a creeper' event you can use 'the creeper' instead of 'the entity'.

An expression for using an item or entity type with a different amount.

ID: 995

Called when a block is broken by a player. If you use 'on mine', only events where the broken block dropped something will call the trigger.

Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 997
Title: On Burn

Addon: Skript

[on] [block] burn[ing] [[of] %itemtypes/blockdatas%]

Called when a block is destroyed by fire.

Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.6 (BlockData support)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 998
Title: On Place
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [block] (plac(e|ing)|build[ing]) [[of] %itemtypes/blockdatas%]

Called when a player places a block.

Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 999
Title: On Fade
Syntax Type: event

[on] [block] fad(e|ing) [[of] %itemtypes/blockdatas%]
Description:
Called when a block 'fades away', e.g. ice or snow melts.

ID: 1000
Title: On Form
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [block] form[ing] [[of] %itemtypes/blockdatas%]
Description:
Called when a block is created, but not by a player, e.g. snow forms due to snowfall, water freezes in cold biomes. This isn't called when block spreads (mushroom growth, water physics etc.), as it has its own event (see spread event).
Event Values: event-block, event-location, event-world, past event-block
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.6 (BlockData support)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1001

Addon: Skript

Called when a living entity (including players) dies.

Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1002
Title: On Spawn
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] spawn[ing] [of %entitydatas%]
Description:
Called when an entity spawns (excluding players).

Called when a crop grows. Alternative to new form of generic grow event.

Addon: Skript

Description:
Called when an entity receives damage, e.g. by an attack from another entity, lava, fire, drowning, fall, suffocation, etc.
Event Values: event-damage cause, event-damage source, event-projectile
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.7 (by entity)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1005
Title: On Chat
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] chat
Description:
Called whenever a player chats.
Use chat format to change message format.
Use chat recipients to edit chat recipients.
Event Values: event-player, event-world
Compatible Addon Version: 1.4.1
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1006
Title: On Grow
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] grow[th] [of (%structuretypes%|%itemtypes/blockdatas%)]
[on] grow[th] from %itemtypes/blockdatas%
[on] grow[th] [in]to (%structuretypes%|%itemtypes/blockdatas%)
[on] grow[th] from %itemtypes/blockdatas% [in]to (%structuretypes%|%itemtypes/blockdatas%)
Description:
Called when a tree, giant mushroom or plant grows to next stage.
"of" matches any grow event, "from" matches only the old state, "into" matches only the new state,and "from into" requires matching both the old and new states.
Using "and" lists in this event is equivalent to using "or" lists. The event will trigger if any one of the elements is what grew.
Event Values: event-block, event-blocks, event-location, event-world, future event-block, future event-blocks, past event-block
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.2-dev20 (plants), 2.8.0 (from, into, blockdata)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1007
Title: On Target
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [entity] target
[on] [entity] un[-]target
Description:
Called when a mob starts/stops following/attacking another entity, usually a player.
Event Values: event-command sender, event-entity, event-entity type, event-location, event-world
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1008

ID: 1011
Title: On Experience Spawn

Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [e]xp[erience] [orb] spawn

Description:
Called whenever experience is about to spawn.
Please note that this event will not fire for xp orbs spawned by plugins (including Skript) with Bukkit.

Compatible Addon Version: 2.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1012
Title: On Can Build Check
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [block] can build check
Description:
Called when a player rightclicks on a block while holding a block or a placeable item. You can either cancel the event to prevent the block from being built, or uncancel it to allow it.
Please note that the data value of the block to be placed is not available in this event, only its ID.
Event Values: event-block, event-location, event-player, event-world, past event-block
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0 (basic), 2.0 ([un]cancellable)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1013
Title: On Block Damage
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] block damag(ing|e)
Description:
Called when a player starts to break a block. You can usually just use the leftclick event for this.
Event Values: event-block, event-location, event-player, event-world
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1014
Title: On Flow
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [block] flow[ing]
[on] block mov(e|ing)
Description:
Called when a blocks flows or teleports to another block. This not only applies to water and lava, but teleporting dragon eggs as well.
Event Values: event-block, event-location, event-world, future event-block
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1015

Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [block] ignit(e|ion)
Description:
Called when a block starts burning, i.e. a fire block is placed next to it and this block is flammable.
The burn event will be called when the block is about do be destroyed by the fire.
Event Values: event-block, event-location, event-player, event-world
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1016
Title: On Physics
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [block] physics
Description:
Called when a physics check is done on a block. By cancelling this event you can prevent some things from happening, e.g. sand falling, dirt turning into grass, torches dropping if their supporting block is destroyed, etc.Please note that using this event might cause quite some lag since it gets called extremely often.
Event Values: event-block, event-location, event-world
Compatible Addon Version: 1.4.6
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Called when a piston is about to extend.

Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Called when a piston is about to retract.

Called when a player empties a bucket. You can also use the place event with a check for water or lava.

Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1041
Title: On Bucket fill
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] bucket fill[ing]
[on] [player] fill[ing] [a] bucket
Description:
Called when a player fills a bucket.
Event Values: event-block, event-player, event-world, future event-block
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1042
Title: On Throwing of an Egg
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] throw[ing] [of] [an] egg
[on] [player] egg throw
Description:
Called when a player throws an egg. You can just use the shoot event in most cases, as this event is intended to support changing the hatched mob and its chance to hatch, but Skript does not yet support that.
Event Values: event-world, event-player
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1043
Title: On Fishing
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [fishing] (line|rod) cast
[on] fish (caught|catch)
[on] entity (hook[ed]|caught|catch)
[on] (bobber|hook) (in|hit) ground
[on] fish (escape|get away)
[on] [fishing] (rod|line) reel in
[on] fish bit(e|ing)
[on] (fish approach[ing]|(bobber|hook) lure[d])
[on] fishing state change[d]
Description:
Called when a player triggers a fishing event.
An entity hooked event is triggered when an entity gets caught by a fishing rod.
A fish escape event is called when the player fails to click on time, and the fish escapes.
A fish approaching event is when the bobber is waiting to be hooked, and a fish is approaching.
A fishing state change event is triggered whenever the fishing state changes.
Event Values: event-entity, event-fishing state, event-player, event-projectile, event-world
Compatible Addon Version: 2.10, 2.11 (state change)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1044

Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [player] tool break[ing]
[on] [player] break[ing] (a|the|) tool
Description:
Called when a player breaks their tool because its damage reached the maximum value.
This event cannot be cancelled.
Event Values: event-item stack, event-player, event-world
Compatible Addon Version: 2.1.1
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1045
Title: On Tool Change
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [player['s]] (tool|item held|held item) chang(e|ing)
Description:
Called whenever a player changes their held item by selecting a different slot (e.g. the keys 1-9 or the mouse wheel), not by dropping or replacing the item in the current slot.

Called when the player joins the server. The player is already in a world when this event is called, so if you want to prevent players from joining you should prefer on connect over this event.

Called when the player connects to the server. This event is called before the player actually joins the server, so if you want to prevent players from joining you should prefer this event over on join.

Description:
Called when a player or an entity uses a nether or end portal. Note that 'on entity portal' event does not apply to players.
Cancel the event to prevent the entity from teleporting.
Event Values: event-block, event-chunk, event-command sender, event-entity, event-entity type, event-location, event-player, event-teleport cause, event-world, past event-chunk, past event-location
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.5.3 (entities), 2.13 (location changers)

ID: 1052

Addon: Skript

Called when a player respawns. You should prefer this event over the death event as the player is technically alive when this event is called.

ID: 1053
Title: On Teleport
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:

Description:
This event can be used to listen to teleports from non-players or player entities respectively.
When teleporting entities, the event may also be called due to a result of natural causes, such as an enderman or shulker teleporting, or wolves teleporting to players.
When teleporting players, the event can be called by teleporting through a nether/end portal, or by other means (e.g. plugins).

Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.9.0 (entity teleport)

Please note that there may not always be a player (or other entity) in this event.

Description:
Called when a user clicks on a block, an entity or air with or without an item in their hand.
Please note that rightclick events with an empty hand while not looking at a block are not sent to the server, so there's no way to detect them.

ID: 1101
Title: Potion Effects

apply infinite [ambient] [potion of] %potioneffecttypes% [potion] [[[of] tier] %number%] [without [any] particles] [(whilst hiding [the]|without (the|a)) [potion] icon] to %livingentities% [replacing [the] existing effect]
apply [ambient] [potion of] %potioneffecttypes% [potion] [[[of] tier] %number%] [without [any] particles] [(whilst hiding [the]|without (the|a)) [potion] icon] to %livingentities% [for %timespan%] [replacing [the] existing effect]
Description:
Apply or remove potion effects to/from entities.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0, 2.2-dev27 (ambient and particle-less potion effects), 2.5 (replacing existing effect), 2.5.2 (potion effects), 2.7 (icon and infinite)

ID: 1102
Title: Delay
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
(wait|halt) [for] %timespan%
Description:
Delays the script's execution by a given timespan. Please note that delays are not persistent, e.g. trying to create a tempban script with ban player → wait 7 days → unban player will not work if you restart your server anytime within these 7 days. You also have to be careful even when using small delays!
Compatible Addon Version: 1.4
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1103
Title: Teleport
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[force] teleport %entities% (to|%direction%) %location% [[while] retaining %teleportflags%]
Description:
Teleport an entity to a specific location. 
This effect is delayed by default on Paper, meaning certain syntax such as the return effect for functions cannot be used after this effect.
The keyword 'force' indicates this effect will not be delayed, 
which may cause lag spikes or server crashes when using this effect to teleport entities to unloaded chunks.
Teleport flags are settings to retain during a teleport. Such as direction, passengers, x coordinate, etc.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.10 (flags)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1104
Title: Force Respawn
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
force %players% to respawn
Description:
Forces player(s) to respawn if they are dead. If this is called without delay from death event, one tick is waited before respawn attempt.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.2-dev21
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1105

uncancel [the] event
Description:
Cancels the event (e.g. prevent blocks from being placed, or damage being taken).

Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Exits a given amount of loops and conditionals, or the entire trigger.

ID: 1108
Title: Play Effect

Description:
Plays a visual effect at a given location or on a given entity.
Please note that some effects can only be played on entities, e.g. wolf hearts or the hurt effect, and that these are always visible to all players.

Equips or unequips an entity with the given itemtypes (usually armor).
This effect will replace any armor that the entity is already wearing.

Description:
Shears or un-shears a shearable entity with drops by shearing and a 'sheared' sound. Using with 'force' will force this effect despite the entity's 'shear state'.

Please note that..:

- Force-shearing or un-shearing on a sheared mushroom cow is not possible
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0 (cows, sheep & snowmen), 2.8.0 (all shearable entities)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1114
Title: Replace
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
replace [(all|every)|[the] first] %strings% in %strings% with %string% [with case sensitivity]
replace [(all|every)|[the] first] %strings% with %string% in %strings% [with case sensitivity]
(replace [with|using] regex|regex replace) %strings% in %strings% with %string%
(replace [with|using] regex|regex replace) %strings% with %string% in %strings%

replace [all|every] %itemtypes% with %itemtype% in %inventories%

Replaces all occurrences of a given text or regex with another text. Please note that you can only change variables and a few expressions, e.g. a message or a line of a sign.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0, 2.2-dev24 (multiple strings, items in inventory), 2.5 (replace first, case sensitivity), 2.10 (regex)

ID: 1121
Title: Play Sound
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
play sound[s] %strings% [[with] seed %number%] [(in|from) %soundcategory%] [(at|with) volume %number%] [(and|at|with) pitch %number%] (at|on|from) %locations/entities% [(to|for) %players%]
play sound[s] %strings% [[with] seed %number%] [(in|from) %soundcategory%] [(at|with) volume %number%] [(and|at|with) pitch %number%] [(to|for) %players%] [(at|on|from) %locations/entities%]
Description:
Plays a sound at given location for everyone or just for given players, or plays a sound to specified players. Both Minecraft sound names and Spigot sound names are supported. Playing resource pack sounds are supported too. The sound category is 'master' by default. 

When running 1.19+, playing a sound from an entity directly will result in the sound coming from said entity, even while moving.
If the sound is custom, a location emitter will follow the entity. Do note that pitch and volume 
are reflected based on the entity, and Minecraft may not use the values from this syntax.

Minecraft sometimes has a set of sounds under one sound ID that will randomly play. To counter this, you can directly state which seed to use.

Please note that sound names can get changed in any Minecraft or Spigot version, or even removed from Minecraft itself.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.2-dev28, 2.4 (sound categories), 2.9 (sound seed & entity emitter)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1123
Title: Ban
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
ban [and kick] %strings/offlineplayers% [(by reason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %string%] [for %timespan%]
unban %strings/offlineplayers%
ban [and kick] %players% by IP [(by reason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %string%] [for %timespan%]
unban %players% by IP
IP(-| )ban [and kick] %players% [(by reason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %string%] [for %timespan%]
(IP(-| )unban|un[-]IP[-]ban) %players%
Description:
Bans or unbans a player or an IP address.
If a reason is given, it will be shown to the player when they try to join the server while banned.
A length of ban may also be given to apply a temporary ban. If it is absent for any reason, a permanent ban will be used instead.
We recommend that you test your scripts so that no accidental permanent bans are applied.

Note that banning people does not kick them from the server.
You can optionally use 'and kick' or consider using the kick effect after applying a ban.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.4, 2.1.1 (ban reason), 2.5 (timespan), 2.9.0 (kick)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Shoots a projectile (or any other entity) from a given entity.

disenchant %itemtypes%
Description:
Enchant or disenchant an existing item. Enchanting at a specific level will act as if an enchanting table was used, and will apply the enchantments randomly chosen at that level. Treasure enchantments, like mending, can optionally be allowed. Note that enchanting a book at a specific level will turn it into an enchanted book, rather than a book with enchantments.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0, 2.13 (at level)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

(eject|dismount) (any|the|) passenger[s] (of|from) %entities%

Makes an entity ride another entity, e.g. a minecart, a saddled pig, an arrow, etc.

ID: 1128
Title: Explosion
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[(create|make)] [an] explosion (of|with) (force|strength|power) %number% [%directions% %locations%] [(with fire)]
[(create|make)] [a] safe explosion (of|with) (force|strength|power) %number% [%directions% %locations%]
[(create|make)] [a] fake explosion [%directions% %locations%]
[(create|make)] [an] explosion[ ]effect [%directions% %locations%]
Description:
Creates an explosion of a given force. The Minecraft Wiki has an article on explosions which lists the explosion forces of TNT, creepers, etc.
Hint: use a force of 0 to create a fake explosion that does no damage whatsoever, or use the explosion effect introduced in Skript 2.0.
Starting with Bukkit 1.4.5 and Skript 2.0 you can use safe explosions which will damage entities but won't destroy any blocks.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Description:
Executes a command. This can be useful to use other plugins in triggers.
If the command is a bungeecord side command, you can use the [bungeecord] option to execute command on the proxy.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.8.0 (bungeecord command)

ID: 1130
Title: Message

Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:

Description:
Sends a message to the given player. Only styles written
in given string or in formatted expressions will be parsed.
Adding an optional sender allows the messages to be sent as if a specific player sent them.
This is useful with Minecraft 1.16.4's new chat ignore system, in which players can choose to ignore other players,
but for this to work, the message needs to be sent from a player.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.2-dev26 (advanced features), 2.5.2 (optional sender), 2.6 (sending objects)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1133
Title: Open/Close Inventory

ID: 1147

Syntax Pattern:

Checks whether a player is online. The 'connected' pattern will return false once this player leaves the server, even if they rejoin. Be aware that using the 'connected' pattern with a variable will not have this special behavior. Use the direct event-player or other non-variable expression for best results.

ID: 1166
Title: Comparison
Syntax Type: condition
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
(neither|) %objects% ((is|are)(|(n't| not| neither)) ((greater|more|higher|bigger|larger) than|above)|\>) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((is|are)(|(n't| not| neither)) (greater|more|higher|bigger|larger|above) [than] or (equal to|the same as)|\>=) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((is|are)(|(n't| not| neither)) ((less|smaller|lower) than|below)|\<) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((is|are)(|(n't| not| neither)) (less|smaller|lower|below) [than] or (equal to|the same as)|\<=) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((is|are) (not|neither)|isn't|aren't|!=) [equal to] %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (is|are|=) [(equal to|the same as)] %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (is|are) between %objects% and %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (is not|are not|isn't|aren't) between %objects% and %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were)(|(n't| not| neither)) ((greater|more|higher|bigger|larger) than|above) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were)(|(n't| not| neither)) (greater|more|higher|bigger|larger|above) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were)(|(n't| not| neither)) ((less|smaller|lower) than|below) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were)(|(n't| not| neither)) (less|smaller|lower|below) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((was|were) (not|neither)|wasn't|weren't) [equal to] %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were) [(equal to|the same as)] %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were) between %objects% and %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was not|were not|wasn't|weren't) between %objects% and %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will be|(will (not|neither) be|won't be)) ((greater|more|higher|bigger|larger) than|above) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will be|(will (not|neither) be|won't be)) (greater|more|higher|bigger|larger|above) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will be|(will (not|neither) be|won't be)) ((less|smaller|lower) than|below) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will be|(will (not|neither) be|won't be)) (less|smaller|lower|below) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((will (not|neither) be|won't be)|(isn't|aren't|is not|are not) (turning|changing) [in]to) [equal to] %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will be [(equal to|the same as)]|(is|are) (turning|changing) [in]to) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% will be between %objects% and %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will not be|won't be) between %objects% and %objects%
Description:
A very general condition, it simply compares two values. Usually you can only compare for equality (e.g. block is/isn't of <type>), but some values can also be compared using greater than/less than. In that case you can also test for whether an object is between two others.
Note: This is the only element where not all patterns are shown. It has actually another two sets of similar patters, but with (was|were) or will be instead of (is|are) respectively, which check different time states of the first expression.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 1220
Title: On Placeholder Request
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Ersatz
Syntax Pattern:
[on] (placeholder[api]|papi) request with [the] prefix %string%
Description:
Called when a placeholder is requested. This can be used to make your own placeholders like this:
```
on placeholder request with prefix "custom":
  if the identifier is "hey": # %custom_hey%
    set the result to "hi there %player%!"
  else if the identifier is "bye": # %custom_bye%
    set the result to "bye bye %player%"
```
Event Values: event-string, event-player
Required Plugins: {'name': 'PlaceholderAPI', 'link': 'https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/placeholderapi.6245/'}
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/ersatz.355/

ID: 1258
Title: Evaluate
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: TuSKe
Syntax Pattern:
eval[uate][ logging [[the] error[s]] in %-objects%][ with safety]: (%-strings%|<.+?>)
Description:
This effect will run any Skript effect/condition from a given string or piece of code. The difference between SkQuery's evaluate effect and this is basically it returns all syntaxes errors instead of send them to the console, It can evaluate a long amount of code and see them easily instead of beeing in one line. 
For example, you can run a effect from a string, from a piece of code (without beeing quoted) or the entiry section of code.
Starting from 1.8, you can disallow some syntaxes when evaluating. Read more about it at config file (`TuSKe/config.yml`).
Compatible Addon Version: 1.7.5, 1.8 (filtering syntaxes)
Addon Link: https://github.com/Tuke-Nuke/TuSKe/releases

ID: 1308
Title: Knowledge Book

ID: 1309
Title: Knowledge Recipes
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: TuSKe
Syntax Pattern:
[the] knowledge(s| recipes) of %itemstack%
%itemstack%'[s] knowledge(s| recipes)
Description:
It returns a list of recipes of a knowledge book. You can either set, add and remove recipes, and clear/delete them all.
Return Type: Recipe
Compatible Addon Version: 1.8
Addon Link: https://github.com/Tuke-Nuke/TuSKe/releases

ID: 1310
Title: Last GUI/GUI from id
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: TuSKe
Syntax Pattern:
last[ly] [created] gui
gui [with id] %string%
Description:
It is used to return the last created gui or a gui from a string id.
Return Type: GUI
Compatible Addon Version: 1.7.5
Addon Link: https://github.com/Tuke-Nuke/TuSKe/releases

ID: 1311
Title: Max Durability
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: TuSKe
Syntax Pattern:
[the] max durability of %itemstack%
%itemstack%'[s] max durability
Description:
Returns the max durability of item stack (https://skripthub.net/docs/?id=2152). i.e. 1561 for diamond sword. You can cancel it.
Return Type: integer
Compatible Addon Version: 1.1
Addon Link: https://github.com/Tuke-Nuke/TuSKe/releases

ID: 1312
Title: offline Player from UUID
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: TuSKe
Syntax Pattern:
offline player from [uuid] %string%
Description:
It get a player from a UUID. If you have Bensku's fork dev23+, you can just use parse expression (https://skripthub.net/docs/?search=id:901) using the uuid.
Also, the uuid needs to be from a player that already played on your server, else it will return null value.
Return Type: Offlineplayer
Compatible Addon Version: 1.7.1
Addon Link: https://github.com/Tuke-Nuke/TuSKe/releases

ID: 1313
Title: Online Time
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: TuSKe
Syntax Pattern:
[the] online time of %player%
%player%'[s] online time
Description:
Returns a timespan (https://skripthub.net/docs/?search=id:2167) of online time of player (https://skripthub.net/docs/?search=id:2160) or of the server. Only the online time of player can be edited.
Return Type: Timespan
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0 (player), 1.5.8 (server)
Addon Link: https://github.com/Tuke-Nuke/TuSKe/releases

ID: 1314
Title: Player Data
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: TuSKe
Syntax Pattern:
[the] player data of %offlineplayer%
%offlineplayer%'[s] player data
Description:
Returns a offline player (https://skripthub.net/docs/?search=id:2159) as it was a player, which means that you can get some values like money, inventory, enderchest,etc. Maybe all values doesn't work. If you want to change these values, you will have to save player data (https://skripthub.net/docs/?search=id:1255).
Return Type: Player
Compatible Addon Version: 1.1
Addon Link: https://github.com/Tuke-Nuke/TuSKe/releases

ID: 1315
Title: RGB Color
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: TuSKe
Syntax Pattern:
[the] R[ed, ]G[reen and ]B[blue] [colo[u]r[s]] of %-itemstacks/colors%
%-itemstacks/colors%'[s] R[ed, ]G[reen and ]B[blue] [colo[u]r[s]]
Description:
Returns the rgb color of item stack (https://skripthub.net/docs/?search=id:2152) or color (https://skripthub.net/docs/?search=id:2138). You can set these values only for item stacks, in this case, leather armors.
The RGB color returns a list with 3 numbers and the other expressions returns which one separated.
Return Type: integer
Compatible Addon Version: 1.5.3 (single value of items), 1.6 (list values of items and color)
Addon Link: https://github.com/Tuke-Nuke/TuSKe/releases

ID: 1316
Title: Rabbit Type
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: TuSKe
Syntax Pattern:
[the] rabbit type of %entity%
%entity%'[s] rabbit type
Description:
Returns the type of rabbit. e.g. `black`, `black and white`, `brown`, `gold`, `salt and pepper`, `the killer bunny` and `white`.
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Tuke-Nuke/TuSKe/releases

ID: 1317
Title: Recipe ID
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: TuSKe
Syntax Pattern:
[the] recipe (id|name|key) of %recipes%
%recipes%'[s] recipe (id|name|key)
Description:
Starting from minecraft 1.12, the recipes now has a unique id. Recipes registered by minecraft will have a id `minecraft:%the result item's name%`, an old recipe plugin will be `bukkit:%random uuid%`, while TuSKe will have its id as `tuske:%last recipe id + 1%`. Other plugins may have a different format, but always following `<plugin>:<key>`.**Only for Shaped and Shapeless recipes**
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 1.8
Addon Link: https://github.com/Tuke-Nuke/TuSKe/releases

ID: 1318
Title: Recipe Owner
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: TuSKe
Syntax Pattern:
[the] recipe owner of %recipes%
%recipes%'[s] recipe owner
Description:
Starting from minecraft 1.12, recipes have now the register plugin. If it is a minecraft recipe, it will return as `Minecraft`, if it is an old recipe plugin, it will return as `Bukkit` and everything else will return the plugin's name. **Only for Shaped and Shapeless recipes**
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 1.8
Addon Link: https://github.com/Tuke-Nuke/TuSKe/releases

ID: 1331
Title: Location Circle
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Biosphere2
Syntax Pattern:
circle[s] at %locations%[ with] radius %number%(,| and) density %number%
Description:
Creates a list of locations in the shape of a circle. The density value controls the amount of points. A higher number increases the amount of points. A density of 1 corresponds to 1 point per block.
Return Type: Location
Addon Link: https://github.com/bi0qaw/biosphere2

ID: 1332
Title: Location Cube
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Biosphere2
Syntax Pattern:
cube[s] at %locations% with radius %number%
Description:
Creates a list of locations in the shape of a cube (only the corners!). To get a list of locations including the cube edges use cube outline.
Return Type: Location
Addon Link: https://github.com/bi0qaw/biosphere2

ID: 1333
Title: Location Cube Outline
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Biosphere2
Syntax Pattern:
cube[s] outline[s] at %locations% with radius %number%(,| and) density %number%
Description:
Creates a list of locations in the shape of a cube, including the corners and vertices of the cube. The density value controls the amount of points. A higher number increases the amount of points. A density of 1 corresponds to 1 point per block.
Return Type: Location
Addon Link: https://github.com/bi0qaw/biosphere2

ID: 1334
Title: Location Cylinder Coordinate
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Biosphere2
Syntax Pattern:
cylinder coordinate[s] at %locations% with radius %number%(,| and) yaw %number%(,| and) height %number%
Description:
Gives locations in a cylindrical coordinate system.
Return Type: Location
Addon Link: https://github.com/bi0qaw/biosphere2

ID: 1335
Title: Location Helix
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Biosphere2
Syntax Pattern:
heli(x|xes|ces) at %locations% with radius %number%(,| and) height %number%(,| and) step[(height|size)] %number%(,| and) density %number%
Description:
Creates a list of locations in the shape of a helix. The step parameter determines how many blocks the helix will go upwards in one rotation. The density value controls the amount of points. A higher number increases the amount of points. A density of 1 corresponds to 1 point per block.
Return Type: Location
Addon Link: https://github.com/bi0qaw/biosphere2

ID: 1336
Title: Location Line
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Biosphere2
Syntax Pattern:
line[s] (between|from) %locations% (and|to) %location% with density %number%
Description:
Creates a list of locations in the shape of a line. The density value controls the amount of points. A higher number increases the amount of points. A density of 1 corresponds to 1 point per block.
Return Type: Location
Addon Link: https://github.com/bi0qaw/biosphere2

ID: 1337
Title: Location Line Coordinate
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Biosphere2
Syntax Pattern:
line[ar] (coordinate[s]|position[s]|location[s]) %number% from %locations% to %location%
Description:
Gives a location on the line between two locations. The number parameter describes how far the point is from the first location. A value of 0 corresponds the the start (first location). A value of 1 corresponds to the end (location 2). 0.5 is the midpoint between the two locations.
Return Type: Location
Addon Link: https://github.com/bi0qaw/biosphere2

ID: 1338

%locations% (linked|connected) with density %number%
Description:
Creates a list of locations linking multiple locations with lines. The density value controls the amount of points. A higher number increases the amount of points. A density of 1 corresponds to 1 point per block.
Return Type: Location
Addon Link: https://github.com/bi0qaw/biosphere2

ID: 1524
Title: Is YAML Loaded
Syntax Type: condition
Addon: skript-yaml
Syntax Pattern:
y[a]ml[s] %strings% (is|are) loaded
y[a]ml[s] %strings% ((are|is) not|(is|are)n[']t) loaded
Description:
Checks if one or more YAML files are loaded into memory using said ID.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.3
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/skript-yaml.362/

ID: 1525
Title: Load YAML
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-yaml
Syntax Pattern:
[re]load [(non[(-| )]relative)] [y[a]ml] %string% [as %-string%]
Description:
Loads a YAML file into memory.
  - The first input is the YAML file path (ie. "plugins/MyAwesomePlugin/config.yml").
  - The second input allows you to choose your own ID for this file.
  - If the second input isn't used then the files name minus the extention is used as the ID for example `config.yml` becomes `config`.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/skript-yaml.362/

ID: 1526

Addon: skript-yaml

Description:
Saves the current cached YAML elements to file.
	 - Option to remove extra lines between nodes
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/skript-yaml.362/

ID: 1527
Title: Unload YAML

Addon: skript-yaml

Gets a list of all nodes of a cached YAML file.

Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/skript-yaml.362/

ID: 1530
Title: YAML
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-yaml
Syntax Pattern:
[[skript-]y[a]ml] (value|(node|path) list|(node|path)[s with] keys|list) %string% (of|in|from) %string% [without string checks]
Description:
Gets, sets, removes values/nodes etc.. of a cached yaml file
  - Requires the id used/created from the load effect
  - This expression does not save to file
  - Lists accept list variables for input
  - Using 'without string checks' optional is a tiny bit faster but doesn't check/convert strings for numbers or booleans
Return Type: Object
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/skript-yaml.362/

ID: 1535
Title: Does YAML Path Have Value
Syntax Type: condition
Addon: skript-yaml
Syntax Pattern:
[skript-]y[a]ml [(node|path)[s]] %strings% (of|in|from) %string% has [a] value[s]
[skript-]y[a]ml [(node|path)[s]] %strings% (of|in|from) %string% does(n't| not) have [a] value[s]
Description:
Checks if one or more values exist at a path in a cached YAML file using said ID.
  - First input is the path.
  - Second input is the ID.
  - If multiple paths are checked at once it will return false on the first one found to not contain a value.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/skript-yaml.362/

ID: 1536
Title: YAML Comments/header
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-yaml
Syntax Pattern:
[the] comment[s] (of|from) [y[a]ml] node[s] %strings% (of|in|from) %string% [(with [an] extra line)]
[the] (comment[s] (at|on) [the] top of |header (of|from)) %string% [(with [an] extra line)]
Description:
Gets, sets, deletes comments or the header of a cached yaml file
  - Headers don't contain '#' so add it yourself if you want it
  - Comments can only be at root level ie. 'root' not 'root.something'
  - Both comment and header expressions can be set to multiple elements
  - This expression does not save to file
  - Option to have an extra line or not depending if you use comment or header
  - Any 'extra lines' are removed when deleting comments/headers
Return Type: Object
Compatible Addon Version: 1.1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/skript-yaml.362/

Computes the limit of a given expression. For more details, read the extended description (https://github.com/Syst3ms/Skuared/wiki/Computational-Effects])

Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/.271/

ID: 1573
Title: Register Constant
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-math
Syntax Pattern:
register [new] constant [[with] symbol] %string% [(and|with)] value %number%
Description:
Registers a constant (duh), which can be used in the evaluate expression (described in Evaluating Expressions (https://github.com/Syst3ms/Skuared/wiki/Evaluating-Expressions)).
 A constant name must consist of one letter optionally followed by one or more letters or digits
 If that's any clearer to you, the regex Skuared uses is '[A-Za-z][A-Za-z\\d]*.'
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/.271/

ID: 1574
