ID: 2989
Title: Logger Name
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-logs
Syntax Pattern:
[the] logger name
Description:
Returns the name of the logger in a log event. None if the logger name doesn't exist.
If a plugin logs a message using its plugin logger this will be name of the plugin. i.e. '[<Plugin>] <message>'.
In this case the logged message won't contain this '[Plugin]' prefix. So you can check if the logger name is a valid plugin somehow and merge it with the logged message.
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 0.1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-logs

ID: 2990
Title: Log Level
Syntax Type: type
Addon: skript-logs
Syntax Pattern:
log level[s]
Compatible Addon Version: 0.1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-logs

ID: 3009
Title: On Hand Item Swap
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] swap[ping of] [(hand|held)] item[s]
Description:
Called whenever a player swaps the items in their main- and offhand slots.
Works also when one or both of the slots are empty.
The event is called before the items are actually swapped,
so when you use the player's tool or player's offtool expressions,
they will return the values before the swap -
this enables you to cancel the event before anything happens.
Event Values: event-player, event-world
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3010
Title: On Jump
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] [player] jump[ing]
Description:
Called whenever a player jumps.
This event requires PaperSpigot.
Event Values: event-player, event-world
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3011
Title: On Server List Ping
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] server [list] ping
Description:
Called when a server list ping is coming in, generally when a Minecraft client pings the server to show its information in the server list.
The IP expression can be used to get the IP adress of the pinger.
This event can be cancelled on PaperSpigot 1.12.2+ only and this means the player will see the server as offline (but still can join).

Also you can use MOTD, Max Players, Online Players Count, Protocol Version, Version String, Hover List and Server Icon expressions, and Player Info Visibility and Hide Player from Server List effects to modify the server list.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3012

Syntax Type: condition
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
%players% can fly
%players% (can't|cannot|can not) fly
Description:
Whether a player is allowed to fly.

Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Checks whether the given players have a custom client weather

ID: 3015

Tests whether a chunk is a so-called slime chunk.
Slimes can generally spawn in the swamp biome and in slime chunks.
For more info, see the Minecraft wiki.

Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Checks if a text starts or ends with another.

Execute an effect if a condition is true.

ID: 3019
Title: Hide Player from Server List
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
hide %players% (in|on|from) [the] server list
hide %players%'[s] info[rmation] (in|on|from) [the] server list
Description:
Hides a player from the hover list and decreases the online players count (only if the player count wasn't changed before).
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3020
Title: Leash entities
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
(leash|lead) %livingentities% to %entity%
make %entity% (leash|lead) %livingentities%
un(leash|lead) [holder of] %livingentities%
Description:
Leash living entities to other entities. When trying to leash an Ender Dragon, Wither, Player, or a Bat, this effect will not work.
See Spigot's Javadocs for more info.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3021
Title: Load Server Icon
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
load [the] server icon (from|of) [the] [image] [file] %string%
Description:
Loads server icons from the given files. You can get the loaded icon using the
last loaded server icon expression.
Please note that the image must be 64x64 and the file path starts from the server folder.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3022
Title: Locally Suppress Warning
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[local[ly]] suppress [the] (conflict|variable save|[missing] conjunction|starting [with] expression[s]|variable[ name][s] contain[s|ing] colon[s]|deprecated syntax|unreachable code|constant condition[s]) warning[s]
Description:
Suppresses target warnings from the current script.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3023
Title: Player Info Visibility
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
hide [all] player [related] info[rmation] [(in|on|from) [the] server list]
(show|reveal) [all] player [related] info[rmation] [(in|to|on|from) [the] server list]
Description:
Sets whether all player related information is hidden in the server list.
The Vanilla Minecraft client will display ??? (dark gray) instead of player counts and will not show the
hover hist when hiding player info.
The version string can override the ???.
Also the Online Players Count and
Max Players expressions will return -1 when hiding player info.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3024
Title: Toggle Flight
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
(allow|enable) (fly|flight) (for|to) %players%
(disallow|disable) (fly|flight) (for|to) %players%
Description:
Toggle the flight mode of a player.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3025
Title: Cooldown Time/Remaining Time/Elapsed Time/Last Usage/Bypass Permission
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] remaining [time] [of [the] (cooldown|wait) [(of|for) [the] [current] command]]
[the] elapsed [time] [of [the] (cooldown|wait) [(of|for) [the] [current] command]]
[the] ((cooldown|wait) time|[wait] time of [the] (cooldown|wait) [(of|for) [the] [current] command])
[the] last usage [date] [of [the] (cooldown|wait) [(of|for) [the] [current] command]]
[the] [cooldown] bypass perm[ission] [of [the] (cooldown|wait) [(of|for) [the] [current] command]]
Description:
Only usable in command events. Represents the cooldown time, the remaining time, the elapsed time,
the last usage date, or the cooldown bypass permission.
Return Type: Object
Compatible Addon Version: 2.2-dev33
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3026
Title: Hover List
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [custom] [player|server] (hover|sample) ([message] list|message)
[the] [custom] player [hover|sample] list
Description:
The list when you hover on the player counts of the server in the server list.
This can be changed using texts or players in a server list ping event only. Adding players to the list means adding the name of the players.
And note that, for example if there are 5 online players (includes fake online count) in the server and the hover list is set to 3 values, Minecraft will show "... and 2 more ..." at end of the list.
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Returns the given item type with the specified lore added to it.
If multiple strings are passed, each of them will be a separate line in the lore.
Return Type: Item Type
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3028
Title: Last Loaded Server Icon
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [last[ly]] loaded server icon
Description:
Returns the last loaded server icon with the load server icon effect.
Return Type: Server Icon
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3029

Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] leash holder[s] of %livingentities%
%livingentities%'[s] leash holder[s]
Description:
The leash holder of a living entity.
Return Type: Entity
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3030
Title: MOTD
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [(default)|(shown|displayed)] (MOTD|message of [the] day)
Description:
The message of the day in the server list. This can be changed in a server list ping event only.
'default MOTD' returns the default MOTD always and can't be changed.
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3031
Title: Max Players
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [(real|default)|(fake|shown|displayed)] max[imum] player[s] [count|amount|number|size]
[the] [(real|default)|(fake|shown|displayed)] max[imum] (count|amount|number|size) of players
Description:
The count of max players. This can be changed in a server list ping event only.
'real max players' returns the real count of max players of the server and can be modified on Paper 1.16 or later.
Return Type: integer
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3, 2.7 (modify max real players)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3032
Title: Online Player Count
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [((real|default)|(fake|shown|displayed))] [online] player (count|amount|number)
[the] [((real|default)|(fake|shown|displayed))] (count|amount|number|size) of online players
Description:
The amount of online players. This can be changed in a server list ping event only to show fake online player amount.
real online player count always return the real count of online players and can't be changed.
Return Type: long
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3033
Title: Protocol Version
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [server] [(sent|required|fake)] protocol version [number]
Description:
The protocol version that will be sent as the protocol version of the server in a server list ping event. For more information and list of protocol versions visit wiki.vg.
If this protocol version doesn't match with the protocol version of the client, the client will see the version string.
But please note that, this expression has no visual effect over the version string. For example if the server uses PaperSpigot 1.12.2, and you make the protocol version 107 (1.9),
the version string will not be "Paper 1.9", it will still be "Paper 1.12.2".
But then you can customize the version string as you wish.
Also if the protocol version of the player is higher than protocol version of the server, it will say
"Server out of date!", and if vice-versa "Client out of date!" when you hover on the ping bars.

This can be set in a server list ping event only
(increase and decrease effects cannot be used because that wouldn't make sense).
Return Type: long
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3034
Title: Scoreboard Tags
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[(all [[of] the]|the)] scoreboard tags of %entities%
%entities%'[s] scoreboard tags
Description:
Scoreboard tags are simple list of texts stored directly in the data of an entity.
So this is a Minecraft related thing, not Bukkit, so the tags will not get removed when the server stops. You can visit visit Minecraft Wiki for more info.
This is changeable and valid for any type of entity. Also you can use use the Has Scoreboard Tag condition to check whether an entity has the given tags.

Requires Minecraft 1.11+ (actually added in 1.9 to the game, but added in 1.11 to Spigot).
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3035

Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:

Description:
Icon of the server in the server list. Can be set to an icon that loaded using the
load server icon effect,
or can be reset to the default icon in a server list ping.
'default server icon' returns the default server icon (server-icon.png) always and cannot be changed.
Return Type: Server Icon
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3037
Title: Version String

Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [shown|custom] version [string|text]
Description:
The text to show if the protocol version of the server doesn't match with protocol version of the client. You can check the protocol version expression for more information about this.
This can only be set in a server list ping event.
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3157
Title: Connect
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
connect %players% to [proxy|bungeecord] [server] %string%
send %players% to [proxy|bungeecord] server %string%
transfer %players% to server %string% [on port %number%]
Description:
Connect a player to a server running on your proxy, or any server supporting transfers. Read below for more information.
If the server is running Minecraft 1.20.5 or above, you may specify an IP and Port to transfer a player over to that server.
When transferring players using an IP, the transfer will not complete if the `accepts-transfers` option isn't enabled in `server.properties` for the server specified.
If the port is not provided, it will default to `25565`.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3, 2.10 (transfer)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3158
Title: Title - Reset
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
reset [the] title[s] [of %players%]
reset [the] %players%'[s] title[s]
Description:
Resets the title of the player to the default values.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3159
Title: Title - Send
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
send title %string% [with subtitle %string%] [to %players%] [for %timespan%] [with fade[(-| )]in %timespan%] [[and] [with] fade[(-| )]out %timespan%]
send subtitle %string% [to %players%] [for %timespan%] [with fade[(-| )]in %timespan%] [[and] [with] fade[(-| )]out %timespan%]
Description:
Sends a title/subtitle to the given player(s) with optional fadein/stay/fadeout times for Minecraft versions 1.11 and above. 

If you're sending only the subtitle, it will be shown only if there's a title displayed at the moment, otherwise it will be sent with the next title. To show only the subtitle, use: send title " " with subtitle "yourtexthere" to player.

Note: if no input is given for the times, it will keep the ones from the last title sent, use the reset title effect to restore the default values.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3322
Title: Custom Generator
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Kosmos
Syntax Pattern:
[custom] [(world|chunk)] generator %string%
Description:
Not an actual event, but rather an event-level scope used to code a custom generator, with the specified ID. Under the main "event" line you can have three different sub-scopes that handle generation:
initiation: This is called once at the beginning of a world's generation. This is specifically intended for optionally setting the world's spawn, but can also be used for other things you need to do at the start of generation.
generation: This is called whenever a chunk is being generated. All custom generators should use this to do their main generation of the world, using the given chunkdata to set the materials of the blocks in the chunk. Note that no block information beyond the material can be set during this stage. Any block state necessary beyond the material should be set during the population stage.
population: This is called after a chunk and all adjacent chunks (not including ones that are diagonal) have been generated, to add certain blocks on top which may require (or be made easier) by being able to put blocks on more than one chunk (ex. adding flowers). This stage should also be used if you need to specify blockdata in addition to the material.
Event Values: event-world, event-java.util.Random, event-chunkdata, event-biomegrid, event-chunk
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/kosmos.726/

If a world with the name (specified or from the creator) already exists, this will just load that world instead of creating a new one.

Description:
Creates a world with the specified name, optionally with a few settings. Optionally you can specify that the world should be automatically loaded on server start. See the environment type and worldtype type for valid environments and worldtypes respectively. Generator settings can either be custom superflat codes or customized world codes (for customized world codes the worldtype needs to be 'customized'). If a world with the specified name already exists, this will just load that world instead of creating a new one.

Description:
An expression for a certain property of the moving border of the specified world:original diameter: The diameter of the border when it was last stablefinal diameter: The diameter that the border will be when it stabilizesremaining distance: The distance the border still has to go before it stabilizes
Return Type: Number

ID: 3339
Title: Property of Border
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Kosmos
Syntax Pattern:
((diameter|side length|size)|damage amount|damage buffer|warning distance|warning time) of %world%
%world%'s ((diameter|side length|size)|damage amount|damage buffer|warning distance|warning time)
Description:
An expression for a certain property of the specified world's border:
diameter: The diameter/size/side length (Note: you should use 'diameter' instead of 'size' to refer to this property, as 'size' conflicts with Skript's size expression)
damage amount: The amount of damage a player will take per second if they are outside both the border and the damage buffer
damage buffer: The distance (in blocks) outside of the border a player can be before taking damage
warning distance: The distance a player has to be within the border to see the red warning effect
warning time: The amount of time the border should be within of reaching a player to show that player the red warning effect.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/kosmos.726/

[(%-players%|group %-string%)'[s]] tablist[s] (contains|(does|do|doesn't|does not|don't|do not) contain) players
[the] tablist[s] [of (%-players%|group %-string%)] (contains|(does|do|doesn't|does not|don't|do not) contain) players
players are (visible|hidden) in [the] tablist[s] [(for|of) (%-players%|group %-string%)]
players are (visible|hidden) in [(%-players%|group %-string%)'[s]] tablist[s]
Description:
Checks whether the specified or all tablist(s) allow player tabs to be visible. Setting this to false prevents any player tabs from being seen in the specified or all tablist(s) (players who join will be automatically hidden). Setting this to true immediately makes all player tabs visible in the specified or all tablist(s). Use the Show or Hide in Tablist effect if you would like to set this condition to be true without immediately showing all players. Note that it is possible for this condition/expression to be true yet no player tabs are visible if they are hidden manually using the Show or Hide in Tablist effect. In this case, players who join will still be visible in the tablist unless manually hidden using the effect.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3373
Title: Player Tab is Visible
Syntax Type: condition
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [player] tab of %player% is (visible|hidden) [for (%-players%|group %-string%)]
%player%'s [player] tab is (visible|hidden) [for (%-players%|group %-string%)]
%player% is (visible|hidden) in [(%-players%|group %-string%)'[s]] tablist[s]
%player% is (visible|hidden) in [the] tablist[s] [(for|of) (%-players%|group %-string%)]
Description:
Checks whether the first player's tab is visible in the specified or all tablist(s).
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3374

scores [are] (enabled|disabled) in [(%-players%|group %-string%)'[s]] tablist[s]
Description:
Checks whether the specified or all tablist(s) have scores enabled. This only applies to enabling scores using MundoSK's tablist syntaxes.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3375
Title: Add or Remove Columns or Rows in Tablist
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
add ([a] (column|row)|%-number% (column|row)s) [with icon %-skin%] to [the] [array] tablist[s] [of (%-players%|group %-string%)]
add ([a] (column|row)|%-number% (column|row)s) [with icon %-skin%] to [(%-players%|group %-string%)'[s]] [array] tablist[s]
remove ([a] (column|row)|%-number% (column|row)s) from [the] [array] tablist[s] [of (%-players%|group %-string%)]
remove ([a] (column|row)|%-number% (column|row)s) from [(%-players%|group %-string%)'[s]] [array] tablist[s]
Description:
Adds or removes the specified amount of rows or columns to the specified or all tablist(s), optionally giving those rows/columns the specified icon instead of the default for the tablist(s).
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3376
Title: Enable or Disable Array Tablist
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
(enable|activate) [the] array tablist [for (%-players%|group %-string%)] [with [%-number% columns] [%-number% rows] [(default|initial) (head|icon|player_head) %-skin%]]
(disable|deactivate) [the] array tablist [for (%-players%|group %-string%)]
Description:
Enables or disables array tablist in the specified or all tablist(s) The array tablist creates a grid of tabs that allows you to use grid coordinates to easily modify individual tabs. When enabling, you can specify the amount of columns (defaults to 4), the amount of rows (defaults to 20), and the initial icon (defaults to a white texture). See the Size of Array Tablist and Icon of Array Tab expressions for more info. Note that it is recommended to use the default tablist dimensions of 4x20 to avoid issues with skins. If the array tablist is already enabled, it will be replaced with a blank one matching the new specifications. Note that when enabling the array tablist, all simple tabs will be removed and all player tabs will be hidden. When disabling the array tablist, all player tabs will be visible, and there will be no simple tabs.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3377
Title: Clear Player Tab Modifications
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
(clear|reset) [all] player tab modifications [for (%-players%|group %-string%)]
Description:
Resets all of the tabs representing players in the specified or all tablist(s) to normal. This will make all players visible in the tablist(s) and reset any display name, latency, and score changes.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3378
Title: Show or Hide in Tablist
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
(show|hide) [the] [player] tab[s] of %players% [for (%-players%|group %-string%)]
(show|hide) %players%'[s] [player] tab[s] [for (%-players%|group %-string%)]
(show|hide) %players% in [(%-players%|group %-string%)'[s]] tablist[s]
(show|hide) %players% in [the] tablist[s] [of (%-players%|group %-string%)]
(show|hide) %players% [for (%-players%|group %-string%)] in [the] tablist[s]
Description:
Shows or hides certain players in the specified or all tablist(s). Note: if the Players Are Visible condition/expression is set to false in a certain tablist and you show a player in that tablist using this effect, then the condition/expression will become true but only that player will become unhidden.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3379

create [a] simple tab %string% [for (%-players%|group %-string%)] [with [priority %-string%] [[display] name %-string%] [(ping|latency) [bars] %-number%] [(head|icon|skull) %-skin%] [score %-number%]]
Description:
Creates a simple tab in the specified or all tablist(s) with the specified id and properties. If a specified player already has a simple tab with the specified id in their tablist, that tab will be deleted before creating the new tab. This effect will not work for a specified player if they have the array tablist enabled.

Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

Enables or disables scores in the specified or all tablist(s).This only applies to scores using MundoSK's tablist syntaxes.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3383
Title: Add Players to Tablist Group
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
add %players% to tablist group %string%
Description:
Adds the specified players to the specified tablist group. This means that you can make modifications to the tablist of the specified group, and those modifications will be applied to those players that have been added to the group. However, you can also modify the tablist of an individual player and the tablists of the rest of the group will be unchanged. Players can be added to multiple tablist groups without conflict as long as the modifications made to each tablist group are independent of each other, meaning they don't both, for example, change the display name of the same tab, or one of them change the display name while the other one hides the tab (you can see how that would conflict). The modifications that have been previously applied to the specified tablist group will be applied to the specified players (modifications that have become redundant will not be applied).
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3384
Title: Delete Tablist Group
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
delete tablist group %string%
Description:
Removes all players from the specified tablist group. Like the Remove Players from Tablist Group effect, this will not make any modifications to the tablists of those players. This will also reset modifications that have been applied to the specified tablist group, meaning that if a new player were to be added to the group, modifications applied to the group before it was deleted would not be applied to the player. If you don't want to reset these modifications, see the Empty Tablist Group effect.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3385

Description:
Removes all players from the specified tablist group. Like the Remove Players from Tablist Group effect, this will not make any modifications to the tablists of those players. This will also not reset modifications that have been applied to the specified tablist group, meaning that if a new player were to be added to the group, modifications applied to the group previously would be applied to the player. If you also want to reset these modifications, see the Delete Tablist Group effect.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3388
Title: Dimension of Array Tablist
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
[the] amount of (column|row)s in [(%-players%|group %-string%)'[s]] [array] tablist[s]
Description:
An expression for the amount of rows or columns in the specified or all array tablist(s). There can be 1 to 4 columns.For each amount of columns, there is a specified range for the amount of rows:
1 Column: 1 to 20 rows
2 Columns: 11 to 20 rows
3 Columns: 14 to 20 rows
4 Columns: 16 to 20 rows
This is due to the fact that Minecraft allows 1 to 80 total tabs, and for each amount, there is only one way the tablist can appear. Minecraft only allows a maximum of 20 tabs in one column, so the tabs will try to fill as few columns as possible will adhering to this rule. For example, if there are 40 tabs, this is satisfied by a 2x20 tablist, but for 41 and 42 you need 3x14.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3412
Title: WebSocket Client Template
Syntax Type: event
Addon: WebSKT
Syntax Pattern:
websocket client %string%
Description:
Not an actual event, but rather a template for a websocket client, with the specified ID. Under the main "event" line you can have five different sub-scopes that handle websocket events:
on open: This is called when the websocket connection initially opens.
on handshake: This is called before 'on open', when the response handshake has been received from the server, but before the websocket is technically open, meaning you can't yet send messages to the server.
on message: This is called when the other end of the websocket connection sends a message.
on error: This is called when an error occurs related to the websocket connection. If this section is not present and the config option 'print_websocket_errors' is true, then WebSKT will print the error to the console.
on close: This is called when the websocket connection is closed.
There are also two more sub-scopes that control aspects other than events: 
websocket var[iable]s: Under this sub-scope you can list variable names that should be scoped at the level of the websocket client instance, meaning that the values of those variables are maintained through different events.
constructor %string%: You can use this sub-scope to specify an alternate syntax for creating an instance of this websocket client template. The code that you write under this sub-scope will be run when that syntax is called to create a new instance. In this code you need to make sure to set the Remote Server URI expression.
Event Values: event-websocket, event-string, event-java.lang.Throwable, event-number, event-boolean
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/webskt.728/

ID: 3413
Title: WebSocket Server Template
Syntax Type: event
Addon: WebSKT
Syntax Pattern:
websocket server %string%
Description:
Not an actual event, but rather a template for a websocket server, with the specified ID. Under the main "event" line you can have seven different sub-scopes that handle websocket events:
on start: This is called when the websocket server is started.
on stop: This is called when the websocket server is stopped. 
This is not called if the websocket server is stopped due to the Minecraft server stopping.
on handshake: This is called before 'on open', when a client has sent a request handshake, allowing you to modify the response handshake to be sent as well as verify that the client's request is valid, and refuse the request if you deem it to be invalid. Note that you can't send messages to the client at this point.
on open: This is called when a client opens a websocket connection with this websocket server.
on message: This is called when the other end of a websocket connection sends a message.
on error: This is called when an error occurs related to a websocket connection.If this section is not present and the config option 'print_websocket_errors' is true, then WebSKT will print the error to the console.
on close: This is called when a websocket connection is closed.
There are also two more sub-scopes that control aspects other than events: 
server var[iable]s: Under this sub-scope you can list variable names that should be scoped at the level of the websocket server instance, meaning that the values of those variables are maintained through all different events.
websocket var[iable]s: Under this sub-scope you can list variable names that should be scoped at the level of the particular connection to a websocket client, meaning that the values of those variables are maintained for events involving the same particular client, but will have separate values for events involving other clients or events not associated with particular clients.
Event Values: event-websocket, event-string, event-java.lang.Throwable, event-number, event-boolean
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/webskt.728/

ID: 3425
Title: Handshake Request/Response/New
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: WebSKT
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [websocket] request [handshake]
[the] [websocket] response [handshake]
[a] new [websocket] handshake
Description:
An expression for some handshake:
request: The handshake sent by a websocket client to a websocket server, used in the 'on open' section of a websocket server template or the 'on handshake' section of a websocket client or server template
response: The handshake sent by a websocket server responding to a request by a websocket client, used in the 'on open' section of a websocket client template or the 'on handshake' section of a websocket client or server template
new: A new handshake object, currently only useful for specifying additional HTTP headers in the New Websocket expression
Return Type: Handshake

ID: 3430
Title: New WebSocket
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: WebSKT
Syntax Pattern:
[[a] new] websocket %string% connected to uri %string% [with (handshake|http) headers %-handshake%]
Description:
Creates a new websocket connection using the websocket client with the specified id, connecting to the specified URI. Optionally, you can specify additional HTTP headers, which you can use to add additional information in the initial connection (ex. a password). A header is a mapping from one string (the name) to another (the value). Each header has a unique name.You can specify headers by creating a new handshake, setting its headers, and then specifying it in the syntax here. Keep in mind that any other information stored in the handshake will be ignored by this expression.
Return Type: WebSocket
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/webskt.728/

ID: 3440
Title: Retrieve Skin
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
retrieve [(slim)] skin from (file|url) %-string% [[with] timeout %-timespan%] into %object%
retrieve skin (from uuid %-string%|of %-offlineplayer%|from blueprint %-blueprint%) [[with] timeout %-timespan%] into %object%
Description:
Retrieves a certain skin from online and places it into the specified variable (the object expression at the end). The retrieved skin is either a skin made from the specified image file, a skin from the specified URL, or the skin of either the specified offline player or the offline player with the specified uuid. If you are retrieving a skin made from an image file or from a URL, you can specify it as slim, meaning it would have the smaller arm size like the default Alex skin does, as opposed to the larger arms of the default Steve skin. Note that since this effect has to retrieve data from online APIs, it is a delayed effect and all code following the effect will also be delayed. Tablisknu uses the Mineskin API for retrieving skins based on image files and URLs.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

Description:
It will play sound at specific location with given pitch and volume for everyone.
Use bukkit "Sound" enum names as sound name.
List of names is here: https://hub.spigotmc.org/javadocs/bukkit/org/bukkit/Sound.html
Bukkit names may be in any case heigh and may be separated with "." instead of "_".
If sound name will be not recognized, error will NOT be thrown like in Skript's play sound, so your scripts will not crash and will be safe.
There will be notification in console in this case with given sound name that is invalid.

ID: 3533

%players% can('t| not) see [holo[gram][s]] %holograms%

Checks whether the given players can see the given holograms. Use the `Hologram Visibility` effect to hide/show holograms.

Checks whether the given hologram allows placeholders.

ID: 3535

ID: 3536

Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:

Description:
Checks whether the given hologram is deleted. When you delete a hologram that is stored in a variable, the hologram object will still exist in the variable but will not be usable. This condition exists to check this case.

Checks whether the given entity is a part of a hologram. It is not possible to get the hologram.

Description:
Checks whether the given hologram line is click-able.

ID: 3539

[holo[gram] line[s]] %hologramlines% (is|are) [((non[-]|un))]touch[-]able

Description:
Checks whether the given hologram line is touchable.

Description:
Checks whether the given hologram is visible by default.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3541
Title: Is Text/Item Line
Syntax Type: condition
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
[holo[gram] line[s]] %hologramlines% (is|are) [a[n]] ((text|string)|item) line[s]
[holo[gram] line[s]] %hologramlines% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) [a[n]] ((text|string)|item) line[s]

Checks whether the given hologram line is a text line or an item line. The `Hologram Line Content` expression can be used to get the text or the item.

ID: 3542
Title: Add Hologram Line
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
append [((click|touch|interact)[-]able|interactive)] [line[s]] %strings/itemtypes% to [holo[gram][s]] %holograms%
prepend [((click|touch|interact)[-]able|interactive)] [line[s]] %strings/itemtypes% to [holo[gram][s]] %holograms%
insert [((click|touch|interact)[-]able|interactive)] [line[s]] %strings/itemtypes% in[to] [holo[gram][s]] %holograms% at line %number%
insert [((click|touch|interact)[-]able|interactive)] [line[s]] %strings/itemtypes% in[to] [holo[gram][s]] %holograms% at [the] %number%(st|nd|rd|th) line
Description:
Adds new lines to a hologram. `insert` means adding after the specified line and moving the next lines below.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3543
Title: Allow Placeholders in Hologram
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
(allow|enable) [the] placeholders (in|for) [holo[gram][s]] %holograms%
(disallow|disable) [the] placeholders (in|for) [holo[gram][s]] %holograms%
Description:
Allows/disallows placeholders in a hologram. Disallowed by default.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3544
Title: Create Hologram
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
(create|spawn) [a] [new] holo[gram] [with [((click|touch|interact)[-]able|interactive)] line[s] %strings/itemtypes%] [%direction% %location%] [and store [it] in [[the] variable] %objects%]
(create|spawn) [a] [new] holo[gram] [with [((click|touch|interact)[-]able|interactive)] line[s] %strings/itemtypes%] that follows %entity% [[with] offset [(of|by|in|to)] [[the] direction] %directions%] [and store [it] in [[the] variable] %objects%]
Description:
Creates a new hologram.

Besides the `store in %variable%`, the `Last Created Hologram` expression can be used to get the created hologram.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3545
Title: Delete Hologram
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
(delete|remove|clear) holo[gram][s] %holograms%
Description:
Deletes a hologram. The hologram type has the delete changer already, but this effect exists for variables. For example `delete {_holo}` would delete the variable but you can use `delete hologram {_holo}` to avoid that.

When you delete a hologram that is stored in a variable, the hologram object will still exist in the variable but will not be usable. You should delete the variable too in this case.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3546
Title: Following Hologram
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
(make|let) [holo[gram][s]] %holograms% (start following|follow) %entity% [[with] offset [(of|by|in|to)] [[the] direction] %directions%]
(make|let) [holo[gram][s]] %holograms% (stop following|unfollow)
Description:
Makes a hologram start/stop following an entity.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3547
Title: Hologram Visibility
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
hide [holo[gram][s]] %holograms% (from|for) %players%
reveal [holo[gram][s]] %holograms% (to|for|from) %players%
reset [the] visibilit(y|ies) of [holo[gram][s]] %holograms% [for %players%]
(make|let) [holo[gram][s]] %holograms% (invisible|hidden) by default
(make|let) [holo[gram][s]] %holograms% visible by default
Description:
Changes visibility of a hologram for the given players or makes a hologram invisible/visible by default. Resetting hologram visibility means setting the visibility to the default value (visible if not changed).
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3548
Title: Make Hologram Line Click-able/Touchable
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
(make|let) [holo[gram] line[s]] %hologramlines% [((un|non[-]))]click[-]able
(make|let) [holo[gram] line[s]] %hologramlines% [((un|non[-]))]touch[-]able
(make|let) [holo[gram] line[s]] %hologramlines% [((non[-]|un))](interactive|interact[-]able)
Description:
Makes a hologram line click-able or/and touchable. 

- **Click-able:** when a player clicks on the line, the `Hologram Line Click` event will be triggered
- **Touchable:** when a player tries to pickup the item in the line, the `Hologram Line Touch` event will be triggered
- **Interactive:** includes both click-able and touchable
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3549

Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:

Description:
Teleports a hologram to a specific location.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3550
Title: All Holograms
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
[all] [the] holo[gram]s [([created] by|of|under|from) skript-holo]
[all] [the] holo[gram]s ([created] by|of|under|from) [the] [plugin[s]] %strings%
Description:
Returns all the holograms created by skript-holo or other plugins *except HolographicDisplays*.

Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3551
Title: Followed Entity of Hologram

Addon: skript-holo

[the] entit(y|ies) followed by [holo[gram][s]] %holograms%

ID: 3552

Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:

%holograms%'[s] [following] offset[s]

Returns offset (directions) of a following hologram. Can be set.

ID: 3553

Returns the following holograms of an entity. Use the `Following Hologram` effect to make an exiting hologram start/stop following an entity.

%holograms%'[s] (creation|spawned) date[s]
Description:
Returns the creation date of a hologram.
Return Type: Date
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3555
Title: Hologram Height
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [physical] height[s] of [holo[gram][s]] %holograms%
%holograms%'[s] [physical] height[s]
Description:
Returns the physical height of a hologram.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3556
Title: Hologram Line Content
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
[the] (content|(text|string)|item)[s] (of|in) [holo[gram] line[s]] %hologramlines%
%hologramlines%'[s] (content|(text|string)|item)[s]

Returns content (text or item) of a hologram line. Please note that there are hologram line to text and item converters so you can use a hologram line like a text or an item (e.g. give first line of holo to player)
Return Type: Object
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3557
Title: Hologram Line Number
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
[the] line number[s] of [holo[gram] line[s]] %hologramlines%
%hologramlines%'[s] line number[s]
Description:
Returns the number of a hologram line. But please note that getting line number of a hologram line will check every line of the hologram. You shouldn't make systems that relies on line numbers, but contents.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3558
Title: Hologram Lines
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
[all] [the] lines of [holo[gram][s]] %holograms%
%holograms%'[s] [all] lines

Description:
Returns lines of a hologram. Can be changed, removing a text or an item means it will search lines that match exactly with the input and remove them.

It is possible to create new lines using the `set` changer, for example if the hologram has 3 lines and you set line 5, the line 4 will be blank.
Return Type: Hologram Line
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3559
Title: Last Created Hologram
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [last[ly]] [(created|spawned)] holo[gram]
Description:
Holds the hologram that was created most recently with the `Create Hologram` effect.
Can be deleted using the `delete/clear` changer which means the hologram will be removed from the world and this expression will be empty.
Return Type: Hologram
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3560
Title: Parent Hologram of Hologram Line
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [parent[s]] holo[gram][s] of [holo[gram] line[s]] %hologramlines%
%hologramlines%'[s] [parent[s]] holo[gram][s]
Description:
Returns the parent hologram of a hologram line.
Return Type: Hologram
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3561
Title: Hologram
Syntax Type: type
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
holo[gram][s]
Description:
A HolographicDisplays hologram. Can be deleted using the `delete/clear` changer or can be reset using the `reset` changer. When you delete a hologram that is stored in a variable, the hologram object will still exist in the variable but will not be usable. You should delete the variable too in this case.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3562
Title: Hologram Line
Syntax Type: type
Addon: skript-holo
Syntax Pattern:
holo[gram][( |-)]line[s]
Description:
A line of a HolographicDisplays hologram. Can be deleted using the 'delete/clear' changer.

Has converters to `text`, `item type` and `number`. Converters mean that you can use this type like the converted types. For example you can do `give line 1 of hologram to player` and `if event-hologram-line is 5:`, but please note that getting line number of a hologram line will check every line of the hologram. You shouldn't make systems that relies on line numbers, but contents.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Blueyescat/skript-holo

ID: 3563
Title: Make Entity Glowing with Color
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MorkazSk
Syntax Pattern:
[morkazsk] make %entities% glow with color %string% for %players%
Description:
This effect will make entity glow with specific color. To unglow use NONE as color.
All color names: BLACK(0, "0"), DARK_BLUE(1, "1"), DARK_GREEN(2, "2"), DARK_AQUA(3, "3"), DARK_RED(4, "4"), DARK_PURPLE(5, "5"), GOLD(6, "6"), GRAY(7, "7"), DARK_GRAY(8, "8"), BLUE(9, "9"), GREEN(10, "a"), AQUA(11, "b"), RED(12, "c"), PURPLE(13, "d"), YELLOW(14, "e"), WHITE(15, "f"), NONE(-1, "");
Compatible Addon Version: 1.2-beta1
Addon Link: https://github.com/MorkaZ/MorkazSk/releases

ID: 3673
Title: New Merchant
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
[a] new merchant named %string%
Description:
Create a new CMO (custom merchant object), that can be manipulated, edited and opened to a player.
Requires a name.
Return Type: Merchant
Compatible Addon Version: 0.1.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3674
Title: New Merchant Recipe
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
[a] new (merchant recipe|trade) of %itemtype% and %itemtype% for %itemtype%
Description:
Creates a new MerchantRecipe object, that can be added to a merchant, villager or wandering trader.
The syntax requires three singular items. Air can be used in place of the second item.

Trades using Air as the first or third ingredient cannot be completed.

MerchantRecipes created have 99999 uses and provide no experience by default. This is due to issues created with experience from a custom merchant object.
Return Type: MerchantRecipe
Compatible Addon Version: 0.1.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3675
Title: Merchant Recipe Count
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
[the] (recipe|trade) count of merchant %merchant%
[the] (recipe|trade) count of villager %entity%
Description:
Get the current recipe count of a merchant object or a villager/wandering trader.
Return Type: Integer
Compatible Addon Version: 0.1.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3676
Title: Set Trades
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
set [(the|all)] (trade|recipe)[s] of [merchant] %merchant% to %merchantrecipes%
set [(the|all)] (trade|recipe)[s] of [(villager|[wandering ]trader)] %entity% to %merchantrecipes%
Description:
Replace all of a merchant or villager/wandering trader's current recipes with a new list of merchant recipes.

Note: setting to an empty list will clear the trades.
You may still force-open the window, but you will not be able to open it by manually clicking a villager.
Compatible Addon Version: 0.1.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3677
Title: Set Trade
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
set trade %number% of [merchant] %merchant% to %merchantrecipe%
set trade %number% of [(villager|[wandering ]trader)] %entity% to %merchantrecipe%
Description:
Set an individual trade of a merchant or villager/wandering trader to a singular merchant recipe.
Reminder:
Recipe indices go 0, 1, 2, ... like inventory slots. You cannot set a trade unless the index already exists.
If you need to add a new trade, please use the ADD syntax.
Compatible Addon Version: 0.1.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3678
Title: Open Merchant
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
open merchant %merchant% to %players%
open villager %entity% to %players%
Description:
Open a merchant or villager/wandering trader to players.
This allows them to trade, following the normal villager rules.

Traditionally, villagers can only trade with a single player at a time. This syntax allows you to force multiple players.
Compatible Addon Version: 0.1.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3679
Title: Enable/Disable Trade
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
enable (trade|recipe) %number% of [merchant] %merchant%
enable (trade|recipe) %number% of [(villager|[wandering ]trader)] %entity%
disable (trade|recipe) %number% of [merchant] %merchant%
disable (trade|recipe) %number% of [(villager|[wandering ]trader)] %entity%
Description:
This allows you to enable/disable a recipe of a merchant, villager or wandering trader.

Disabling a recipe sets the max uses to 0, meaning it will never restock.
Enabling it sets the max uses to 99999. You might exercise caution when using this with ordinary villagers.

Reminder:
Recipe indices go 0, 1, 2, ... like inventory slots. You cannot toggle a trade unless the index exists.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3680

Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
add (trade|recipe)[s] %merchantrecipes% to [merchant] %merchant%
add (trade|recipe)[s] %merchantrecipes% to [(villager|[wandering ]trader)] %entity%
Description:
Add a (list of) merchant recipes to a merchant or villager/wandering trader.

Note: before 1.0.0, the object type must be explicit
Compatible Addon Version: 0.1.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3681
Title: Open Container Inventory
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
open (barrel|lectern|loom|cartography (table|gui)|stone[ ]cutter|dispenser|dropper|hopper) named %string% to %players%
open [fake] (smoker|blast furnace|ender chest|grindstone) named %string% to %players%
Description:
Open one of the new 1.14 containers to a player as a GUI.
Also includes some old containers that were missing from vanilla Skript, such as fake ender chests, hoppers, dispensers and droppers.

Some of these can be used for their normal crafting. However, some of them might cause issues. I have done my best to restore their function.

You can set the name of each, which is displayed at the top. Fake lecterns do not display the name and currently have no useful function.
Compatible Addon Version: 0.2.0
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14

Syntax Pattern:

Description:
Make an insentient entity walk to a location.
This works for most mobs.
It does NOT work for players or armour stands, or things that don't walk.

Maximum distance is defined by the entity tracking range in the config.

Entities may lose interest and wander off.

ID: 3687
Title: Vehicle Steer
Syntax Type: event
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
[on] vehicle steer[ing]
Description:
Called frequently when a player is riding any entity.
event-string returns the key pressed.
The keys are "W", "A", "S", "D", "SHIFT" and "SPACEBAR".
If no key is pressed, the event-string will be "NONE".
This currently is not cancellable, due to how my listener is implemented.
If you wish to stop them dismounting, I would suggest using the dismount event as well.
Event Values: event-player
event-string
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Protocollib', 'link': 'https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/protocollib.1997/'}
Compatible Addon Version: 0.1.5

ID: 3694
Title: Is Wet
Syntax Type: condition
Addon: MiSK

%entities% (is|are) wet

Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14

ID: 3695
Title: Force Mount
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
mount %entities% on %entity%
Description:
Forces an entity to illegally mount another.
This can be used to put multiple passengers on a single vehicle, which is not possible using the Bukkit API.
Be careful! All of these entities will send vehicle steer packets to the server. Use it wisely.
Compatible Addon Version: 0.2.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3696
Title: Make Invisible
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
make %entities% invisible
make %entities% visible
Description:
Make any entity properly invisible. Does not use packets or potions.
Similar to an armour stand's {Invisible:1b} NBT tag.

Sometimes, this doesn't work in the same tick as spawning the entity.
Compatible Addon Version: 0.2.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3697
Title: Move Entity / Set Location
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
move %entities% to %location/entity%
Description:
Move an entity to a location/entity. This will take all passengers/hangers-on with the entity.
It is effectively the same as setting the actual coordinates of the entity within its NBT, but much safer to use.
The effect will not work if they are not in the same world.
This also prevents the screen flickering/jittering that is caused by teleporting a player.
It does not affect velocity or path goals.

Example Uses:
Teleporting entities with multiple, stacked passengers.
Making armour stands follow an entity.
Altering the yaw/pitch of a player without changing velocity.
Compatible Addon Version: 0.2.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3698

Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
set [the] swimming state of %entities% to %boolean%
Description:
Alter an entity's swimming state, to true or false.
Compatible Addon Version: 0.2.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

Description:

Compatible Addon Version: 0.2.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14

ID: 3700
Title: Horse Jump

Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:

Description:

Event Values: event-entity
Compatible Addon Version: 0.2.5
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3701
Title: Clear Trades
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
clear [(the|all)] (trade|recipe)[s] of [merchant] %merchant%
clear [(the|all)] (trade|recipe)[s] of [(villager|[wandering ]trader)] %entity%
Description:
Clears the trade list of a merchant/villager/wandering trader.
As of MiSK 1.0.0, you no longer need to specify whether the object is a merchant or a villager.

The same effect can be achieved by setting the trades to an empty list.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3702

Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
set [the] [e]xp[erience] of [villager] %entities% to %number%
Description:
Set the villager's experience. This works through the progress bar that is displayed in their inventory.

When the bar is filled, the villager will level up.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3703
Title: Villager Level
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:
set [the] level of [villager] %entities% to %number%
Description:
Sets the level of a villager.
The level goes from 1 to 5 and represents the villager's rank and the badge displayed on their belt. When a villager levels up they will gain new trades.

Hint: When creating a villager with custom recipes, set the level to 5 to prevent the trades being lost/type changing due to Minecraft's profession system.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3704

Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MiSK
Syntax Pattern:

Description:
Sets the profession of a villager. The profession takes a capitalised string.

Valid professions list can be found here:
https://papermc.io/javadocs/paper/1.14/org/bukkit/entity/Villager.Profession.html

Reminders:
Level 1 villagers with no exp will automatically lose/re-assign their profession, due to Minecraft's behaviour.
A villager's trades will only restock if they have access to a suitable profession "block." See Minecraft's wiki for more info.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.14
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/misk-addon-1-14-1.67507/

ID: 3725

The resource pack condition can be used

This event will be triggered once when the player accepts or declines the resource pack request,

Addon: Skript

Description:
Breaks the block and spawns items as if a player had mined it

You can add a tool, which will spawn items based on how that tool would break the block 
(ie: When using a hand to break stone, it drops nothing, whereas with a pickaxe it drops cobblestone)
Compatible Addon Version: 2.4
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3730
Title: Enable/Disable/Unload/Reload Script
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
((enable|load)|reload|disable|unload) script [file|named] %string% [with errors]
((enable|load)|reload|disable|unload) skript file %string% [with errors]
((enable|load)|reload|disable|unload) %scripts% [with errors]
Description:
Enables, disables, unloads, or reloads a script.

Disabling a script unloads it and prepends - to its name so it will not be loaded the next time the server restarts.
If the script reflection experiment is enabled: unloading a script terminates it and removes it from memory, but does not alter the file.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.4, 2.10 (unloading)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3731

Addon: Skript

(launch|deploy) [[a] firework [with effect[s]]] %fireworkeffects% at %locations% [([with] (duration|power)|timed) %number%]
Description:
Launch firework effects at the given location(s).
Compatible Addon Version: 2.4
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3732
Title: Send Resource Pack
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
send [the] resource pack [from [[the] URL]] %string% to %players%
send [the] resource pack [from [[the] URL]] %string% with hash %string% to %players%
Description:
Request that the player's client download and switch resource packs. The client will download 
the resource pack in the background, and will automatically switch to it once the download is complete. 
The URL must be a direct download link.

The hash is used for caching, the player won't have to re-download the resource pack that way. 
The hash must be SHA-1, you can get SHA-1 hash of your resource pack using 
this online tool.

The resource pack request action can be used to check 
status of the sent resource pack request.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.4
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3733
Title: Stop Sound
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
stop (all sound[s]|sound[s] %strings%) [(in [the]|from) %soundcategory%] [(from playing to|for) %players%]
stop playing sound[s] %strings% [(in [the]|from) %soundcategory%] [(to|for) %players%]
Description:
Stops specific or all sounds from playing to a group of players. Both Minecraft sound names and Spigot sound names are supported. Resource pack sounds are supported too. The sound category is 'master' by default. A sound can't be stopped from a different category. 

Please note that sound names can get changed in any Minecraft or Spigot version, or even removed from Minecraft itself.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.4, 2.7 (stop all sounds)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 3752
Title: Packet Field Alias
Syntax Type: event
Addon: ThatPacketAddon
Syntax Pattern:
packet (field|info) aliases for %packettype%
Description:
Not an actual event, but rather a group of packet field aliases to be used with packets of the specified packettype. Packet info aliases are aliases for specific usages of packet info expressions. Under the main scope lines are written in the form '<new syntax> = <old syntax>', where the old syntax is how you would normally write an expression for the desired packet info, and the new syntax is how you want to be able to write it. Note that the new syntax is essentially being registered as a Skript syntax, so you can write it with features of Skript syntax like optional parts enclosed in '[]', and multiple usages of '%packet%' are allowed in your syntax, though only one of them should be possible to use at a time since only one packet is used to evaluate the alias Your syntax does not have to require or even allow the usage of '%packet%'. In this case, 'event-packet' will be used as the packet. A small addition to normal Skript syntax is that now, if you would like to have a group of different options for syntax but also have the whole thing be optional, instead of writing '[(a|b|...)]' you can write '[a|b|...]'.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: http://tlatoani.us/thatpacketaddon

ID: 3753
Title: Packet Event
Syntax Type: event
Addon: ThatPacketAddon
Syntax Pattern:
packet event %packettypes% [with (lowest|low|normal|high|highest|monitor) priority]
Description:
Called when a packet of one of the specified types is being sent or received. You can optionally specify a priority; triggers with higher priority will be called later (so high priority will come after low priority, and monitor priority will come last). By default, the priority is normal.
Event Values: event-packet, event-packettype, event-player
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: http://tlatoani.us/thatpacketaddon

ID: 3765
Title: Legacy Enum Field of Packet
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: ThatPacketAddon
Syntax Pattern:
(arbitrary|%-string%) penum %number% [of %packet%]
Description:
An expression for an enum field of a packet (first see the Packet Info o expression for a more general explanation of packet fields). The specified string is the name of the enum you are getting/setting. Using arbitrary gives you access to all enum fields, rather than just one particular type, and allows you to access certain enums that are NMS types rather than ProtocolLib and thus can't be accessed by their name.
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: http://tlatoani.us/thatpacketaddon

ID: 3766
Title: Legacy Field of Packet
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: ThatPacketAddon
Syntax Pattern:
(%-classinfo/string%|object|location|uuid|material|item|blockdata) pinfo %number% [of %packet%]
(%-classinfo/string%|collection|bytebuffer) array pinfo %number% [of %packet%]
Description:
An expression for the packet field of either the specified type or referred to by the specified string, with the specified index, of the specified packet. For example, 'string' can be used as the specified type to get a string field in the specified packet. 'array' must be included in the syntax when the fields are plural (ex. 'string array'). Use 'object' in order to access all fields of the packet. However, some fields will have objects in raw forms that cannot be easily used in Skript without the use of addons such as skript-mirror. Many of these fields can be converted into Skript types; most of these fields must be referred to by a certain string rather than a type: "uuid", "material", "blockdata", "collection" array, "bytebuffer" array (The last two are plural and must have array included in the syntax.
Return Type: Object
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: http://tlatoani.us/thatpacketaddon

ID: 3767
Title: Legacy JSON Field of Packet
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: ThatPacketAddon

(%-string%|chatcomponent|playerinfodata) array pjson %number% [of %packet%]
Description:
An expression for certain fields of packets (first see the Packet Info expression for a more general explanation) that don't have equivalent types in Skript, and thus must be represented in the form of a jsonobject. The names of the fields can be written as strings but don't have to be. Current accept JSON infos: 'chatcomponent', 'serverping', 'datawatcher', 'watchablecollection', 'gameprofile', 'nbt', 'chatcomponent' array, 'playerinfodata' array.
Return Type: JSONObject
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: http://tlatoani.us/thatpacketaddon

ID: 3809
Title: NBT Field of Packet
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: ThatPacketAddon
Syntax Pattern:
nbt [packet] field [%number%] [of %packet%]
Description:
The value of the field numbered at the specified index of the specified packet's NBT fields. The NBT, as well as any NBT values contained in it, is represented as a jsonobject with three parts:
The name, with index/key "name", which is just the name (sometimes null)
The type, with index/key "type", which is the type of NBT, and can have the following values:
- "byte", "short", "int", "long", "float", "double", the basic number types
- "string", for strings
- "byte_array" and "int_array", for basic number array types
- "compound", for an NBT compound
- "list_something", such as "list_string" or "list_compound", for a list of some other type
The value, with index/key "value", which is the actual value:
- In the cases of the number types and string type this is just the number/string (when accessing using a list variable in Skript it's like {_nbt::value}
- In the case of the number array types and the list type this is an array of the objects (when accessing using a list variable in Skript it's like {_nbt::value::*}, ex. {_nbt::value::1} for the first element)
- In the case of the compound it's a JSONObject of the NBT values, each also having its own name, type and value (when accessing through a list variable in Skript it's: {_nbt::value::example_name::name} for the name (which is the same as the index, so it will be "example_name"), {_nbt::value::example_name::type} for the type, let's say "string", and {_nbt::value::example_name::value} for the actual value, let's say "pie") The index defaults to 0 if unspecified and the packet expression defaults to event-packet if unspecified.
Return Type: JSONObject
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: http://tlatoani.us/thatpacketaddon

ID: 3810
Title: NBT List Field of Packet
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: ThatPacketAddon
Syntax Pattern:
nbt list [packet] field [%number%] [of %packet%]
Description:
The value of the field numbered at the specified index of the specified packet's NBT list fields. The NBT values contained int list, as well as any NBT values contained in those NBT values, are represented as a jsonobject with three parts:
The name, with index/key "name", which is just the name (sometimes null)
The type, with index/key "type", which is the type of NBT, and can have the following values:
- "byte", "short", "int", "long", "float", "double", the basic number types
- "string", for strings
- "byte_array" and "int_array", for basic number array types
- "compound", for an NBT compound
- "list_something", such as "list_string" or "list_compound", for a list of some other type
The value, with index/key "value", which is the actual value:
- In the cases of the number types and string type this is just the number/string (when accessing using a list variable in Skript it's like {_nbt::value}
- In the case of the number array types and the list type this is an array of the objects (when accessing using a list variable in Skript it's like {_nbt::value::*}, ex. {_nbt::value::1} for the first element)
- In the case of the compound it's a JSONObject of the NBT values, each also having its own name, type and value (when accessing through a list variable in Skript it's: {_nbt::value::example_name::name} for the name (which is the same as the index, so it will be "example_name"), {_nbt::value::example_name::type} for the type, let's say "string", and {_nbt::value::example_name::value} for the actual value, let's say "pie") The index defaults to 0 if unspecified and the packet expression defaults to event-packet if unspecified.
Return Type: JSONObject
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: http://tlatoani.us/thatpacketaddon

ID: 3832

The profile contained in this playerinfodata. Determines the skin that will be displayed as an icon if this playerinfodata is used as a tab in the tablist.

Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: http://tlatoani.us/thatpacketaddon

ID: 3833
Title: Latency of PlayerInfoData
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: ThatPacketAddon
Syntax Pattern:
(ping|latency) of [player]info[data] %playerinfodata%
[player]info[data] %playerinfodata%'s (ping|latency)
Description:
The latency contained in this playerinfodata, respresented as an integer amount of milliseconds. Different values of latency will result in different latency bar icons being displayed if the specified playerinfodata is used as a tab in the tablist:
latency < 0 ms will show a red X
0 ms <= latency < 150 ms will show 5 bars
150 ms <= latency < 300 ms will show 4 bars
300 ms <= latency < 600 ms will show 3 bars
600 ms <= latency < 1000 ms = 1 second will show 2 bars
1000 ms = 1 second <= latency will show 1 bar
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: http://tlatoani.us/thatpacketaddon

ID: 3848
Title: Color Blueprint
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
color %blueprint% as %argb%
Description:
Colors all of the specified blueprint as the specified color. Normally the blueprint you specify will be a section of a larger blueprint, as we normally don't need skins that are a single color.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3849
Title: Create Blueprint
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
create blueprint of %skin% in %object%
create [(slim)] [(head|body|right arm|left arm|right leg|left leg) [(front|back|right|left|top|bottom) face]] blueprint from (file|url) %string% in %object%
Description:
Creates a blueprint and puts it in the specified variable (the %object% at the end). This is a delayed effect as it requires retrieving image data either from online or from a file, so if used inside of a function the function will return before the effect (and any code after the effect) completes. The first syntax creates the blueprint from an existing skin. The second syntax creates from an image at the specified url or file path. If the blueprint is meant to be a blueprint of a certain part of a skin (ex. the head, right leg, etc.), a part in the second layer of a skin, or even a certain face (front, back, top, etc.) of a part, you can specify that. You can also specify whether it is meant to be a slim skin (skin with thinner arms).
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3850
Title: Overlay Blueprint on Blueprint
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
overlay %blueprint% on %blueprint%
Description:
Overlays the first specified blueprint on the second specified blueprint. To understand what "overlay" means, you can imagine the blueprints being pieces of paper (possibly with transparency), and just putting one piece of paper on top of the other. So if the first specified blueprint is fully opaque, then it will completely replace the second specified blueprint, which is sometimes what you need. Note that the overlaying is done by matching the top left corner of both blueprints, so if the first specified blueprint is smaller than the second, then the lower and or the right pixels of the second specified blueprint won't have anything overlayed on them.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3851
Title: Recolor Blueprint
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
recolor %argb% in %blueprint% as %argb%
Description:
Recolors all pixels with the first specified color in the specified blueprint as having the second specified color.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3852
Title: Blank Blueprint
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
blank [(slim)] [ (head|body|right arm|left arm|right leg|left leg) [(front|back|right|left|top|bottom) face]] blueprint
Description:
A new, blank blueprint. All pixels are colored transparent by default, which for the first layer means that they will render as black (but still act as transparent when using blueprint syntaxes).If the blueprint is meant to be a blueprint of a certain part of a skin (ex. the head, right leg, etc.), a part in the second layer of a skin, or even a certain face (front, back, top, etc.) of a part, you can specify that. You can also specify whether it is meant to be a slim skin (skin with thinner arms).
Return Type: Blueprint
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3853

Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
[(second layer)] (head|body|right arm|left arm|right leg|left leg) [(front|back|right|left|top|bottom) face] pixels of %blueprint%
Description:
A blueprint containing the region of the specified blueprint representing the specified body part, optionally restricted to a certain face (front, back, left, right, top, bottom) of the body part. You can specify whether the blueprint should be of the first (main) layer of the body part, or the second layer (which can have transparency).
Return Type: Blueprint
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

Produces a copy of the specified blueprint. Changes made to the copy won't affect the original, so this might be used, for example, if you have a template that you modify to produce skins.
Return Type: Blueprint
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3855

The color of the specified pixel in the specified blueprint.

Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3856
Title: Face of Body Part Blueprint
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
(front|back|right|left|top|bottom) face pixels of %blueprint%

A blueprint containing the region of the specified blueprint representing the specified face of the body part. The specified blueprint must represent a single body part in a skin.

Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3857
Title: Rectangle of Blueprint
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:

Description:
A blueprint consisting of a rectangular region of the specified blueprint, delineated by the two specified corners of the rectangle. Changes made to the returned blueprint will also be made to the corresponding pixels in the original. You can additionally use the Copy of Blueprint expression if you don't want this to happen.
Return Type: Blueprint
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3858
Title: ARGB Color
Syntax Type: type
Addon: Tablisknu
Syntax Pattern:
argb
Description:
A color that can have transparency; 'rgb' stands for the usual red, green, blue values (from 0 to 255 inclusive), and 'a' stands for the alpha value that describes transparency, where 0 means fully transparent, and 255 means fully opaque. When using normal Skript colors (green, blue, etc.) as argb colors, they will be converted as fully opaque. You can also write argb colors as hex codes: `rgb RRGGBB` will be a fully opaque argb color from the hex code RRGGBB, and `argb AARRGGBB` will be an argb colors with transparency AA and rgb hex code RRGGBB.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3859

Addon: Tablisknu

A blueprint of a skin that can be modified in Skript and then used to create an actual skin that you can put on players. A blueprint could be for a whole skin or be a section of another blueprint.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/tablisknu.727/

ID: 3983
Title: Cancel Drops
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
(cancel|clear|delete) [the] drops [of (items|[e]xp[erience][s])]
(cancel|clear|delete) [the] (item|[e]xp[erience]) drops
Description:
Cancels drops of items in a death, block break, block drop, and block harvest events.
The dropped experience can be cancelled in a death and block break events.
Please note that using this in a death event doesn't keep items or experience of a dead player. If you want to do that, use the Keep Inventory / Experience effect.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.4, 2.12 (harvest event)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript
