ID: 4010
Title: Complex Translated Message
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: TranSKator
Syntax Pattern:
send complex translated [message[s]] %strings% with [(attachment[s]|input[s])] %strings% to %players%
Description:
Sends a complex translated message to players.
  - This message can be a default one from the Minecraft lang file.
  - It can also be a custom one included via mod or resource pack.
  - Inside the language files, you can use § to colour messages.
  - Complex messages can include placeholder values using '%s' in the lang file.
  - These %s's are filled in with your inputs. To use normal percents, double the %%.
  - You are also able to specify the order using '%1$s' and '%2$s'.
Compatible Addon Version: 0.0.1
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/transkator.74112/

ID: 4011
Title: Simple Translated Message
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: TranSKator
Syntax Pattern:
send [simple] translated [message[s]] %strings% to %players%
Description:
Sends a simple translated message to players.
  - This message can be a default one from the Minecraft lang file.
  - It can also be a custom one included via mod or resource pack.
  - Inside the language files, you can use § to colour messages.
Compatible Addon Version: 0.0.1
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/transkator.74112/

ID: 4013
Title: Color Items
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
(dye|colo[u]r|paint) %itemtypes% %color%
(dye|colo[u]r|paint) %itemtypes% (%number%, %number%, %number%)
Description:
Colors items in a given color. You can also use RGB codes if you feel limited with the 16 default colors. RGB codes are three numbers from 0 to 255 in the order (red, green, blue), where (0,0,0) is black and (255,255,255) is white. Armor is colorable for all Minecraft versions. With Minecraft 1.11 or newer you can also color potions and maps. Note that the colors might not look exactly how you'd expect.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0, 2.2-dev26 (maps and potions)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 4185
Title: Custom Model Data
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [custom] model data of %itemtypes%
%itemtypes%'[s] [custom] model data
[the] [custom] model data (floats|flags|strings|colo[u]rs) of %itemtype%
%itemtype%'[s] [custom] model data (floats|flags|strings|colo[u]rs)
[the] ((complete|full)) [custom] model data of %itemtype%
%itemtype%'[s] ((complete|full)) [custom] model data
Description:
Get/set the custom model data of an item. Using just `custom model data` will return an integer. Items without model data will return 0.
Since 1.21.4, custom model data instead consists of a list of numbers (floats), a list of booleans (flags), a list of strings, and a list of colours. Accessing and modifying these lists can be done type-by-type, or all at once with `complete custom model data`. This is the more accurate and recommended method of using custom model data.
Return Type: Object
Compatible Addon Version: 2.5 2.12 (floats/flags/strings/colours/full model data)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Note that the movement speed attribute cannot be reliably used for players. For that purpose, use the speed expression instead.
Resetting an entity's attribute is only available in Minecraft 1.11 and above.

Description:

When changing the yield, a value greater than 1 will function the same as using 1.
Attempting to change the yield to a value less than 0 will have no effect.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 2.5
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 4274
Title: Explosion Yield
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] explosion (yield|radius|size)
[the] (yield|radius|size) of [the] explosion
Description:
The yield of the explosion in an explosion prime event. This is how big the explosion is.
 When changing the yield, values less than 0 will be ignored.
 Read this wiki page for more information
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 2.5
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 4275

%entities%'[s] explosive (yield|radius|size|power)

The yield of an explosive (creeper, ghast, primed tnt, fireball, etc.). This is how big of an explosion is caused by the entity.
Read this wiki page for more information.
The yield of ghasts can only be set to between 0 and 127.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 2.5, 2.11 (ghasts)

ID: 4279
Title: Time Since/Until

Addon: Skript

ID: 4291
Title: Block Data
Syntax Type: type
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
block[ ]data[s]
Description:
Block data is the detailed information about a block, referred to in Minecraft as BlockStates, allowing for the manipulation of different aspects of the block, including shape, waterlogging, direction the block is facing, and so much more. Information regarding each block's optional data can be found on Minecraft's Wiki. Find the block you're looking for and scroll down to 'Block States'. Different states must be separated by a semicolon (see examples). The 'minecraft:' namespace is optional, as well as are underscores.

ID: 4499
Title: On Enderman/Sheep/Silverfish/Falling Block
Syntax Type: event
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[on] enderman place
[on] enderman pickup
[on] sheep eat
[on] silverfish enter
[on] silverfish exit
[on] falling block fall[ing]
[on] falling block land[ing]
[on] (entity|%*-entitydatas%) chang(e|ing) block[s]
Description:
Called when an enderman places or picks up a block, a sheep eats grass, a silverfish boops into/out of a block or a falling block lands and turns into a block respectively.
event-block represents the old block and event-blockdata represents the new replacement that'll be applied to the block.
Event Values: event-block, event-block data, event-command sender, event-entity, event-entity type, event-location, event-world, future event-block data, past event-block
Compatible Addon Version: unknown, 2.5.2 (falling block), 2.8.0 (any entity support)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 4507
Title: Is Passable
Syntax Type: condition
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
%blocks% (is|are) passable
%blocks% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) passable
Description:
Checks whether a block is passable.
A block is passable if it has no colliding parts that would prevent players from moving through it.
Blocks like tall grass, flowers, signs, etc. are passable, but open doors, fence gates, trap doors, etc. are not because they still have parts that can be collided with.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.5.1
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 4512
Title: Force Attack
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
make %livingentities% attack %entities%
force %livingentities% to attack %entities%
make %livingentities% damage %entities% by %number% [heart[s]]
force %livingentities% to damage %entities% by %number% [heart[s]]
Description:
Makes a living entity attack an entity with a melee attack.
Using 'attack' will make the attacker use the item in their main hand and will apply extra data from the item, including enchantments and attributes.
Using 'damage' with a number of hearts will not account for the item in the main hand and will always be the number provided.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.5.1, 2.13 (multiple, amount)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 4523
Title: Potion Effect of Entity/Item
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [active|hidden|(active and hidden|hidden and active)] %potioneffecttypes% [potion] effect[s] of %livingentities/itemtypes%
%livingentities/itemtypes%'[s] [active|hidden|(active and hidden|hidden and active)] %potioneffecttypes% [potion] effect[s]
Description:
An expression to obtain a specific potion effect type of an entity or item.
When an entity is affected by a potion effect but already has a weaker version of that effect type, the weaker version becomes hidden. If the weaker version has a longer duration, it returns after the stronger version expires.
NOTE: Hidden effects are not able to be changed.
Return Type: skriptpotioneffect
Compatible Addon Version: 2.14
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 4524
Title: Potion Effects of Entity/Item
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [active|hidden|(active and hidden|hidden and active)] potion effects of %livingentities/itemtypes%
%livingentities/itemtypes%'[s] [active|hidden|(active and hidden|hidden and active)] potion effects
Description:
An expression to obtain the active or hidden potion effects of an entity or item.
When an entity is affected by a potion effect but already has a weaker version of that effect type, the weaker version becomes hidden. If the weaker version has a longer duration, it returns after the stronger version expires.
NOTE: Hidden effects are not able to be changed.
NOTE: Clearing the base potion effects of a potion item is not possible. If you wish to do so, just set the item to a water bottle.
Return Type: skriptpotioneffect
Compatible Addon Version: 2.5.2, 2.14 (active/hidden support, more change modes)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 4765

Addon: SkJade
Syntax Pattern:

Description:
Registers a new elementals spell which can be cast.
The spell name and id has to be unique, or the spell will not be created.
IMPORTANT: The function has to return a boolean, and return true where you want the cooldown to be applied, and false where not.

ID: 4858

Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Pesk
Syntax Pattern:

Description:

Compatible Addon Version: 1.6
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/pesk-addon.84062/

ID: 4859

Description:
This is the opposite of the `Allow` effect. This will kick the player attempting to join, and give them a message.

Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/pesk-addon.84062/

ID: 5335
Title: On Packet Event - Skript-Packet
Syntax Type: event
Addon: skript-packet
Syntax Pattern:
[(sync|async)] packet event %packettype% [with (lowest|low|normal|high|highest|monitor) priority]
Description:
Called when a packet of one of the specified types is being sent or received. You can optionally specify a priority triggers with higher priority will be called later (so high priority will come after low priority, and monitor priority will come last). By default, the priority is normal.
Event Values: event-packet event-player
Required Plugins: {'name': 'Protocollib', 'link': 'https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/protocollib.1997/'}
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 1.1 (priority), 2.0 (sync/async)
Addon Link: https://github.com/Anarchick/skript-packet/releases

Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/skjade.1267/

ID: 5480
Title: Nearest Structure
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: SkJade
Syntax Pattern:
[the] (nearest|closest) ((not |un)(explored|discovered)|) [structure [of]] %structure% (in|within) [a] radius [of] %number% (around|at|from|of) %location%
Description:
Find the closest nearby structure of a given structure type. Will not be set if not found. Finding unexplored structures can, and will, block if the world is looking in chunks that gave not generated yet. This can lead to the world temporarily freezing while locating an unexplored structure.
The radius is not a rigid square radius. Each structure may alter how many chunks to check for each iteration. Do not assume that only a radius x radius chunk area will be checked. For example, a woodland mansion can potentially check up to 20,000 blocks away (or more) regardless of the radius used.
This will not load or generate chunks. This can also lead to instances where the server can hang if you are only looking for unexplored structures. This is because it will keep looking further and further out in order to find the structure.
Return Type: Location
Compatible Addon Version: 1.3.0
Addon Link: https://forums.skunity.com/resources/skjade.1267/

Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 6317
Title: Is Plugin Enabled
Syntax Type: condition
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
plugin[s] %strings% (is|are) enabled
plugin[s] %strings% (is|are)(n't| not) enabled
plugin[s] %strings% (is|are) disabled
Description:
Check if a plugin is enabled/disabled on the server.
Plugin names can be found in the plugin's 'plugin.yml' file or by using the '/plugins' command, they are NOT the name of the plugin's jar file.
When checking if a plugin is not enabled, this will return true if the plugin is either disabled or not on the server. 
When checking if a plugin is disabled, this will return true if the plugin is on the server and is disabled.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.6
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

Compatible Addon Version: 1.2.0

Addon: skript-storage
Syntax Pattern:

ID: 6327
Title: Clear Nodes
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-storage
Syntax Pattern:
(remove|delete|reset|clear) [all] node[s] (of|in|from) [the] [file] %string%
Description:
Reset the specified file by deleting every comments (if YAML case) and possible nodes values.
It will basically reset the file to an emtpy one.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.2.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkyCraft78/skript-storage/releases

ID: 6328
Title: Create Data from JSON
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-storage
Syntax Pattern:
(create|init|make) [the] [file] %string% (with|from) [the] [json] %string% [and store (it|the (error|exception)) in %-object%]
Description:
Convert (and check) JSON string to a flat file data.
This will create the desired path, and if exist, will override it.
If the inputted JSON is not valid, no exception will be thrown instead of a whole stack trace.
The specified variable will be clear if no error was found, else it will contains the error message.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.2.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkyCraft78/skript-storage/releases

ID: 6329
Title: Create File Shortcut
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-storage
Syntax Pattern:
[storage] (make|create|register) [a] [new] [(private)] shortcut for [the] [path] %string% as [the] [name] %string%
[storage] (delete|remove) [the] shortcut [(with name|named)] %string%
Description:
Shortcut are completely optional and here to help you gain time while coding.
Instead of specifying the whole file path every time, simple load a shortcut key, which will be replaced by the desired file.
If you create a shortcut for an already existing one, it will be overed.
The private mark will make the shortcut only available in the current script only, to avoid conflict with other potential scripts.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.2.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkyCraft78/skript-storage/releases

ID: 6330
Title: Start Queue
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-storage
Syntax Pattern:
(enable|start) [the] queue for [the] [path] %string%
Description:
Start a new queue for a specific file path.
Every change made with that path will be queued, and not saved directly.
You will either need to save the queue (make every save) or clear it (cancel every changes) to return to a normal state.
This system is recommended when you are managing a huge quantity of data in a single time.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.3.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkyCraft78/skript-storage/releases

ID: 6331
Title: Stop Queue
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: skript-storage
Syntax Pattern:
(restart|stop|save) [the] queue for [the] [path] %string%
clear [the] queue for [the] [path] %string%
Description:
Stop or clear the queue for a specific path.
Of course a queue should be started before this effect in order to work.
Restarting-it (or stopping it) will make every changes happen in one time only (one time file save)
You can also clear the queue, and therefore every changes will be lost.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.2.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkyCraft78/skript-storage/releases

ID: 6332
Title: YAML Headers
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-storage
Syntax Pattern:
[all] [the] [storage] [(data|yaml)] [file] [(framed)] header[s] of %string%
[all] [the] %string%'[s] [storage] [(data|yaml)] [file] [(framed)] header[s]
Description:
Represent the header at the top of an YAML file.
This property can only work with YAML files, and will simply do nothing if used with JSON or TOML
The comment # are already included, means you should not add them yourself!
The framed mark will simply make the header text between a frame, looking more professional.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.2.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkyCraft78/skript-storage/releases

ID: 6333
Title: Node Value
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-storage
Syntax Pattern:
[storage] [the] [(default)] value[(s)] %string% (of|from|in) [the] [(file|shortcut)] %string% [(as (array|list))]
[storage] [the] [(file|shortcut)] %string%'[s] [(default)] value[(s)] %string% [(as (array|list))]
Description:
Represent a node value.
You can get the value from its key, shortcut file are allowed here.
You can set, remove and remove all keys on that property.
In order to keep the comments, for Yaml files, only header & first-layer nodes comments are allowed. Every other will be deleted!

The default mark is only used in set changer (when you set a value).
If the specified node is already set to something, then it'll not override it and do nothing.
Useful when generating default tree for configuration files, and / or updating it while keeping old values.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.2.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkyCraft78/skript-storage/releases

ID: 6334
Title: Node Section
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-storage
Syntax Pattern:
[storage] [the] [node] section [(with key|keyed)] %string% (of|in|from) %string% [(as one (layer|keyset))]
Description:
Return the string list of every nodes the files have, with a specific layer of not.
Imagine a second you have this file (YAML file for example, but works with other types too):

First:
    Second: Hello World!
    Third:
        Fourth: 50
    Lastly: 30
SecondMain: Welcome!

Then, the following code will returns:
node section "First" of "config" # [Second, Third.Fourth, Lastly]
node section "First" of "config" as one layer # [Second, Third, Lastly]
node section "" of "config" # [First.Lastly, First.Third.Fourth, First.Second, SecondMain]
node section "" of "config" as one layer # [First, SecondMain]
Compatible Addon Version: 1.2.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkyCraft78/skript-storage/releases

ID: 6335
Title: Default Node
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-storage
Syntax Pattern:
get [the] [value] %string% (of|from|in) [the] [file] %string% or [(set)] [default] [to] %objects%
Description:
It only works with getter, so you can't set that to anything. Use the 'value XX of XX' property to change them.
This expression will try to get the desired node, and will if the value is not set:
- If the 'set' mark is specified, set the default value provided and return it
- Else, only return the default value provided without changing the file
Compatible Addon Version: 1.2.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkyCraft78/skript-storage/releases

ID: 6336
Title: YAML Comments
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: skript-storage
Syntax Pattern:
[storage] [the] comment[s] of [the] (key|node) %string% of [the] [(yaml|file)] %string%
[storage] [the] [(yaml|file)] %string%'[s] comment[s] of [the] (key|node) %string%
Description:
Represent the comment linked to a node in an YAML file.
This property can only work with YAML files, and will simply do nothing if used with JSON or TOML
The comment # are already included, means you should not add them yourself!
Compatible Addon Version: 1.2.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkyCraft78/skript-storage/releases

ID: 6349
Title: Conditionals
Syntax Type: section
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
else
else [parse] if <.+>
else [parse] if (any|at least one [of])
else [parse] if [all]
[parse] if (any|at least one [of])
[parse] if [all]
[parse] if <.+>
then [run]
<.+>
Description:
Conditional sections
if: executed when its condition is true
else if: executed if all previous chained conditionals weren't executed, and its condition is true
else: executed if all previous chained conditionals weren't executed

parse if: a special case of 'if' condition that its code will not be parsed if the condition is not true
else parse if: another special case of 'else if' condition that its code will not be parsed if all previous chained conditionals weren't executed, and its condition is true
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 6350
Title: Loop
Syntax Type: section
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
loop %objects%
Description:
Loop sections repeat their code with multiple values.

A loop will loop through all elements of the given expression, e.g. all players, worlds, items, etc. The conditions & effects inside the loop will be executed for every of those elements, which can be accessed with ‘loop-’, e.g. send "hello" to loop-player. When a condition inside a loop is not fulfilled the loop will start over with the next element of the loop. You can however use stop loop to exit the loop completely and resume code execution after the end of the loop.

Loopable Values
All expressions that represent more than one value, e.g. ‘all players’, ‘worlds’, etc., as well as list variables, can be looped. You can also use a list of expressions, e.g. loop the victim and the attacker, to execute the same code for only a few values.

List Variables
When looping list variables, you can also use loop-index in addition to loop-value inside the loop. loop-value is the value of the currently looped variable, and loop-index is the last part of the variable's name (the part where the list variable has its asterisk *).
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

[do] while <.+>
Description:
While Loop sections are loops that will just keep repeating as long as a condition is met.

ID: 6581
Title: Create Bounding Box
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skirt
Syntax Pattern:
(bounding|hit)[ ]box of %entities%
(bounding|hit)[ ]box of %blocks%

ID: 6645
Title: Map Edit

start editing a map. the %objects% at the end is to store the map canvas to use for editing.

ID: 6649
Title: Has Potion Effect
Syntax Type: condition
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
%livingentities% (has|have) ([any|a[n]] [active] potion effect[s]|[any|a] potion effect[s] active)
%livingentities% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have ([any|a[n]] [active] potion effect[s]|[any|a] potion effect[s] active)
%livingentities% (has|have) %skriptpotioneffects% [active]
%livingentities% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have %skriptpotioneffects% [active]
Description:
Checks whether an entity has a potion effect with certain properties.
An entity is considered having a potion effect if it has a potion effect with at least the specified properties.
For example, if an entity has an 'ambient speed 5' effect, they would be considered as having 'speed 5'.
For exact comparisons, consider using the Potion Effect of Entity/Item expression in an 'is' comparison.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.6.1 2.14 (support for potion effects)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

NOTE: Currently this can not be set to anything.

ID: 6654
Title: Spawn
Syntax Type: section
Addon: Skript
Syntax Pattern:
(spawn|summon) %entitytypes/entitysnapshots% [%directions% %locations%]
(spawn|summon) %number% of %entitytypes/entitysnapshots% [%directions% %locations%]
Description:
Spawns entities. This can be used as an effect and as a section.

If it is used as a section, the section is run before the entity is added to the world.
You can modify the entity in this section, using for example 'event-entity' or 'cow'. 
Do note that other event values, such as 'player', won't work in this section.

If you're spawning a display and want it to be empty on initialization, like not having a block display be stone, set hidden config node 'spawn empty displays' to true.

Note that when spawning an entity via entity snapshots, the code within the section will not run instantaneously as compared to spawning normally (via 'a zombie').
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0, 2.6.1 (with section), 2.8.6 (dropped items), 2.10 (entity snapshots)
Addon Link: https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript

ID: 7582
Title: Create Mongo collection
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
create [a] mongo[(sk|db)] collection [named] %string% in %mongoskdatabase%
Description:
Quickly create a collection with a specific name in one of your databases. Make sure it does not exist first.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7583
Title: Manage Mongo document
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
(insert|(replace|update)|remove) mongo[(sk|db)] doc[ument][s] %mongoskdocuments% (in[to]|of|from) [collection] %mongoskcollection%
Description:
Firstly, you can insert your Mongo document in the collection you want, with an automatically generated unique identifier if not specified or already existing. This will not replace existing documents with the same identifier, but will insert a new one. Secondly, if you want to replace the document, you can use the replace syntax. Finally, to remove the document, simply use remove. This effect is only a shortcut and simply executes a query with "_id" as the unique identifier. If you have changed the unique ID field, you should not use this effect.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7584
Title: All Mongo collections

Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
[all] [the] mongo[(db|sk)] collections of %mongoskdatabase%
[all] %mongoskdatabase%'[s] mongo[(db|sk)] collections
Description:
Quickly retrieve all the collections contained in a Mongo database.
Return Type: MongoSK Collection
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7585
Title: All Mongo databases

Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
[all] [the] mongo[(db|sk)] databases of %mongoskserver%
[all] %mongoskserver%'[s] mongo[(db|sk)] databases
Description:
Quickly retrieve all the databases contained in a Mongo server.
Return Type: MongoSK Database
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7586
Title: Mongo Embedded Value
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
mongo[(sk|db)] embedded ((field|value)|(array|list)) [with path] %string% of %mongoskdocument%
Description:
It is sometimes redundant to extract a document from a document from a document etc... and undertake several data manipulations on several lines. To remedy this, this expression will only ask you the path (MongoSK specific syntax, be careful) as follows: "foo.bar", or "foo[0].bar" or "foo.bar[2]" for example. Embedded documents must be separated by a dot, and you must specify in brackets the index of the array (starting from 0) if it is a list.
Return Type: Object
Compatible Addon Version: 2.3.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7587
Title: Mongo collection
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
[the] mongo[(sk|db)] collection [named] %string% (of|from) %mongoskdatabase%
Description:
Retrieve a specific collection via its name from a database on your Mongo server. You must specify the database where your collection is located.
Return Type: MongoSK Collection
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7588
Title: Mongo collection document count
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
[the] mongo[(db|sk)] estimated doc[ument][s] count of %mongoskcollections%
%mongoskcollections%'[s] mongo[(db|sk)] estimated doc[ument][s] count
Description:
If you want to know the number of documents in a collection, you should use this expression. Please note that this is an estimate.
Return Type: integer
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7589
Title: Mongo command result
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
(results|documents) of mongo[(sk|db)] command %string% (of|in) database %mongoskdatabase%
Description:
This expression is very useful and gives complete freedom to use your database with MongoSK. Indeed, it allows to execute any command to a database, which will return the documents to you. You are therefore no longer dependent on the features of MongoSK, and you can use any commands. To learn more about the possible commands, see: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/command/.
Return Type: MongoSK Document
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7590
Title: Mongo database
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
[the] mongo[(sk|db)] database [named] %string% (of|from) %mongoskserver%
Description:
Retrieve a specific database from a Mongo server. You must specify in which Mongo server your collection is located.
Return Type: MongoSK Database
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7591
Title: Mongo database name of a collection
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
[the] mongo[(sk|db)] database name of %mongoskcollections%
%mongoskcollections%'[s] mongo[(sk|db)] database name
Description:
Retrieves the name of the database to which the collection belongs. You can then use the expression to retrieve a database by its name if you wish.
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7592
Title: Mongo distinct query
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
(first|all) mongo[(sk|db)] field[s] distincted by [field] %string% [(with|by) [filter] %mongoskfilter%] (of|from) collection %mongoskcollection%
Description:
The distinct query is useful when you want to retrieve a specific field from each document in a given collection. For example, if you have documents with a "name" field, you can use this expression to retrieve all the "name" fields of the documents in the collection. Useful, isn't it?This expression does not accept constructed queries because there is no need to use it. They can only be used with the find query.
Return Type: Object
Compatible Addon Version: 2.2.1
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7593
Title: Mongo document JSON
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
[the] mongo[(db|sk)] json of %mongoskdocuments%
%mongoskdocuments%'[s] mongo[(db|sk)] json
Description:
Retrieve the JSON representation of the document. This expression can be useful to use it with skript-json and convert the document to a Skript variable, and vice versa. You can also define the JSON of the document.
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7594
Title: Mongo document field
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
mongo[(sk|db)] ((field|value)|(array|list)) [named] %string% of %mongoskdocument%
Description:
This expression is extremely important because it allows you to manage the values and lists of your documents. You can define lists, add items to lists, set values, or delete them. If Skript adapters are enabled, you can specify any type of data, and they will be automatically transformed by MongoSK so that they can be registered. So you can store players, blocks, items for example.
Return Type: Object
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7595
Title: Mongo document keys
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
mongo[(sk|db)] keys of [document] %mongoskdocument%
Description:
With this expression, retrieve all the keys of a document. The expression returns a list of text.
Return Type: Text
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7596
Title: Mongo document values
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
mongo[(sk|db)] values of [document] %mongoskdocument%
Description:
With this expression, retrieve all the values of a document. The expression returns a list of different data types.
Return Type: Object
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7597
Title: Mongo filter
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
[[a] new] mongo[(db|sk)] filter [where] field %string% is ((greater|more|higher|bigger|larger|above) [than] or (equal to|the same as)|\>=) %integer/number%
[[a] new] mongo[(db|sk)] filter [where] field %string% is (((greater|more|higher|bigger|larger) than|above)|\>) %integer/number%
[[a] new] mongo[(db|sk)] filter [where] field %string% is ((less|smaller|below) [than] or (equal to|the same as)|\<=) %integer/number%
[[a] new] mongo[(db|sk)] filter [where] field %string% is (((less|smaller) than|below)|\<) %integer/number%
[[a] new] mongo[(db|sk)] filter [where] field %string% is ((not|neither)|isn't|!=) [equal to] %integer/number/string/boolean/mongoskdocument%
[[a] new] mongo[(db|sk)] filter [where] field %string% (is|equals|=) %integer/number/string/boolean/mongoskdocument%
[[a] new] mongo[(db|sk)] filter [where] field %string% (does(n't| not) exist|is not (set|defined))
[[a] new] mongo[(db|sk)] filter [where] field %string% (exists|is (set|defined))
Description:
Create custom Mongo filters to target a certain type of data in your queries to your collections.The comparators are the same as for Skript.
Return Type: MongoSK Filter
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7598
Title: Mongo find query
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
[find] (first|all) mongo[(sk|db)] document[s] [(with|by) [filter] %mongoskfilter%] (of|from) collection %mongoskcollection%
[find] (first|all) mongo[(sk|db)] document[s] (of|from) query %mongoskquery%
Description:
Use this expression if you want to make simple find requests, easily and quickly. To do so, you must specify the type of your query: are you looking for several documents or the first document in the collection? Then, the first means is to use a filter to specify the type of data you are looking for. Finally, you need to specify where the query should ask for the data, i.e. in which collection.The second way is to specify a Mongo request that you will have built beforehand. This will allow you to better specify your request and create a more complex one.You also have the possibility to modify already existing documents and delete documents, in the same way as for making your queries.
Return Type: MongoSK Document
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7599
Title: Mongo joined filters
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
mongo[(sk|db)] joined filters %mongoskfilter% (and|or|nor) %mongoskfilter%
mongo[(sk|db)] joined filters %mongoskfilters% with (and|or|nor) [join] mode
Description:
Thanks to this expression, you will be able to combine two filters to refine your queries. Several types of filter comparison are possible, and, or, and nor.
Return Type: MongoSK Filter
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7600
Title: Mongo joined sorts
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
mongo[(sk|db)] joined sorts %mongosksorts%
Description:
Thanks to this expression, you will be able to combine two sorts to refine your queries.
Return Type: MongoSK Sort
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7601

Addon: MongoSK

[the] mongo[(db|sk)] name[s] of %mongoskdatabases/mongoskcollections%
%mongoskdatabases/mongoskcollections%'[s] mongo[(db|sk)] name[s]
Description:
Retrieve the names of different Mongo elements. You can use this expression to retrieve the name of collections or databases.
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7602

Defines the collection in which the query will run.

Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7603
Title: Mongo query comment
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:

%mongoskqueries%'[s] mongo[(db|sk)] comment
Description:
Defines the comment of the request, in order to better monitor the query on your server. This is optional.
Return Type: Text
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7604
Title: Mongo query disk usage
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
[the] mongo[(db|sk)] disk usage of %mongoskqueries%
%mongoskqueries%'[s] mongo[(db|sk)] disk usage
Description:
Enables writing to temporary files on the server. When set to true, the server can write temporary data to disk while executing the operation. This is optional.
Return Type: Boolean
Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7605
Title: Mongo query filter
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
[the] mongo[(db|sk)] filter of %mongoskqueries%
%mongoskqueries%'[s] mongo[(db|sk)] filter
Description:
Allows you to set a filter associated with the query. This is optional for find queries, but mandatory for delete or replace queries!

Compatible Addon Version: 2.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7606

ID: 7609

ID: 7620
Title: Mongo section document
Syntax Type: section
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
set %object% to [a] new mongo[(db|sk)] document with
Description:
The Mongo section document allows the initialization of a new document and allows to define its fields in a quick and intuitive way with the expression "Mongo section document value". The variable you specify in the first line represents the variable that will contain the document built in the section. You can then use this variable after the end of your section.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7621
Title: Mongo section document value
Syntax Type: section
Addon: MongoSK
Syntax Pattern:
mongo[(sk|db)] [((field|value)|(array|list))] %string%\: %objects%
Description:
This effect can only be used in a Mongo section document, and allows quick assignment of fields to a given document. Be aware that this syntax is only available for basic data manipulation. If your manipulation is not possible via this section, you can perfectly well use the classic field definition expression in addition to this section.
Compatible Addon Version: 2.1.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/Romitou/MongoSK

ID: 7843
Title: Disguise - Item Stack

Addon: Diskuise
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [dropped] item [stack] of [dis(g|k)uise[s]] %disguises%
[dis(g|k)uise[s]] %disguises%'[s] [dropped] item [stack]
Description:
Set or get the item of a disguise.
For Dropped Item Disguises, it returns the item of it.
For Item Frame Disguises, it returns the item inside the frame.
For throwable projectiles (eggs, snowballs, enderpearls, etc.), it returns the displayed item.
Other disguises don't have items associated with them.
Return Type: Item Type
Compatible Addon Version: 0.2-beta1
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/diskuise.101529/

ID: 8535
Title: Debug Marker (1.21.9+ has changed this. Read description)
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: PoaSK
Syntax Pattern:
create debug marker at %locations% with color %color% [[and ]with alpha %-number%] [[and ]with text %-string%] for %players% [for %-timespan%]
Description:
Creates a Minecraft debug marker. Due to Mojang shader change at 1.16 only the green channel functions correctly upto 1.20.2

all colours work on 1.20.4 - 1.21.8

## NOTE: 1.21.9+ only green shows. Color cannot be changed, text cannot be changed it ONLY lasts for 10 seconds.
### Further note: If using via versions:
server versions lower than 1.21.9 will not show the marker to clients 1.21.9+
server versions 1.21.9+ will not show markers to clients below 1.21.9

This is all due to minecraft's changes. These packets are designed for minecraft's developers, thus not updated
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.20.2
Addon Link: https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/poask-skript-addon.104512/

This event requires Paper.

ID: 8962
Title: GPT Chat Completion Request
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript-GPT
Syntax Pattern:
(generate|make) [a] chat[gpt] completion with (prompt|input) %string% [and model %-string%] [and max tokens %-number%] [and temperature %-number%]
(generate|make) [a] chat[gpt] completion with conversation %conversationmessages% [and model %-string%] [and max tokens %-number%] [and temperature %-number%]
Description:
Generate a response to a prompt string using the OpenAI ChatGPT API, based on an input prompt.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.1
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.12
Addon Link: https://github.com/DereWah/Skript-GPT/releases

ID: 8963
Title: GPT Completion Request
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript-GPT
Syntax Pattern:
(generate|make) [a] [gpt] completion with (prompt|input) %string% [and model %-string%] [and max tokens %-number%] [and temperature %-number%]
(generate|make) [a] [gpt] completion with (prompt|input) %string% [and model %-string%] [and max tokens %-number%] [and temperature %-number%] without echo
Description:
Generate a completion of an input string using the OpenAI ChatGPT API, based on an input prompt.
ATTENTION! This syntax does not use the ChatGPT endpoint. You won't receive back a conversation from the AI, just a chat completion. It will try to predict what the message is, it won't respond as an assistant.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.12
Addon Link: https://github.com/DereWah/Skript-GPT/releases

conversation message

This type holds information about a message in a conversation with ChatGPT. It has two main parts, the role (which can only be set to "assistant", "system" or "user") and the content, which is basically whatever string the user or the AI want to send.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.1
Compatible Minecraft Version: 1.12
Addon Link: https://github.com/DereWah/Skript-GPT/releases

ID: 9046
Title: Player - Fake Experience

ID: 9148
Title: Dolphin - Treasure Chest Location
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Lusk
Syntax Pattern:
[the] dolphin treasure [chest] location of %livingentities%
%livingentities%'[s] dolphin treasure [chest] location
Description:
Gets the treasure location the provided dolphins try to guide players to.

This value is calculated if the player has fed the dolphin a fish (which Lusk includes), `DOLPHIN_SWIM_TO_TREASURE` goal.

Can be set, but it only has an effect if the dolphin is currently leading a player, as this value is recalculated next time it leads a player.

The world of the location you give it does not matter, as the dolphin will always use the world it is currently in.
Return Type: Location
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.3
Addon Link: https://github.com/JakeGBLP/Lusk

ID: 9192
Title: Telegram Bot Login
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skelegram
Syntax Pattern:
telegram login to bot %string% with token %string%
Description:
Create a session and authenticate to a telegram bot, given its username and its token.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0-ALPHA
Addon Link: https://github.com/DereWah/Skelegram/releases

ID: 9193
Title: Clear all telegram sessions
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skelegram
Syntax Pattern:
(clear|stop) all telegram sessions
Description:
Close all the telegram sessions that are active. Stops any running bot. You should use this in case you get an api error 409 saying multiple instances are running a single bot. Please note that closing a session may take up to 50 seconds, as it is delayed by the Telegram API itself.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0-ALPHA
Addon Link: https://github.com/DereWah/Skelegram/releases

ID: 9194
Title: Clear Telegram Session
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skelegram
Syntax Pattern:
(clear|stop) telegram session of bot %string%
Description:
Closes the telegram session of a specific bot. Please note that closing a session may take up to 50 seconds, as it is delayed by the Telegram API itself.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0-ALPHA
Addon Link: https://github.com/DereWah/Skelegram/releases

ID: 9195
Title: Send telegram message
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skelegram
Syntax Pattern:
send telegram message %string/telegrammessage% [with markdown] to %telegramuser/telegramchat/number% [with bot %string%]
Description:
Send a telegram message. The message can be a string or can be an existing message. The target chat ID can be used to specify the destination of the message. If used inside of a Telegram Event, the bot to use is automatically detected. To use it outside of a Telegram Event, specify the username of the bot. If a session exists for that bot, the message will be sent.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0-ALPHA
Addon Link: https://github.com/DereWah/Skelegram/releases

ID: 9196
Title: Reply telegram message
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skelegram
Syntax Pattern:
reply to telegram message %telegrammessage% with %telegrammessage/string% [with markdown] [with bot %-string%]
Description:
Send a telegram message, as a reply to another message. The reply message can be a string or can be an existing message. If used inside of a Telegram Event, the bot to use is automatically detected. To use it outside of a Telegram Event, specify the username of the bot. If a session exists for that bot, the message will be sent.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0-ALPHA
Addon Link: https://github.com/DereWah/Skelegram/releases

Description:
This type represents a Telegram Inline Button. You can't add simply the button to a message, but you need first to add it into a keyboard. You can then add the keyboard to the message. (Otherwise, how would Telegram know which position the button would have to be?)

Of a button, you can define its text (the displayed button itself) and its action. If you set its URL, it will open automatically a link when clicked. If you set its callback data, you can specify the data that is sent to the bot when clicked. You can listen to such data with the EvtCallbackQuery
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0-ALPHA
Addon Link: https://github.com/DereWah/Skelegram/releases

Fires whenever a message (or command) is received. You can access the received message with event-telegram message

event-telegram bot

ID: 9246
Title: Team Packet

Description:
Send a scoreboard team packet to player

if using players in teams, you must disable TAB anti-override.

### 1 entity/player can only be in 1 team at a time.
### If adding a player to a team, use their name and not their uuid for the uuid section

for the nametag visibility use one of the following strings (case sensitive):

always
hideForOtherTeams
hideForOwnTeam
never

for collision use one of the following strings (case sensitive):
always
pushOtherTeams
pushOwnTeam
never

ID: 9388
Title: Apply Suggestion
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: SkBriggy
Syntax Pattern:
apply suggestion %string% with tooltip %object%
apply suggestion[s] %objects%
Description:
Apply a suggestion with tooltip or list of suggestions to an argument.
This is used only in the argument registration section of a brig command and the suggestions section of a big command tree.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/ShaneBeee/SkBriggy/releases

ID: 9389
Title: Register Argument
Syntax Type: section
Addon: SkBriggy
Syntax Pattern:
register [optional] %*brigarg% arg[ument] [(named|with name)] %string%
register [optional] %*brigarg% arg[ument] [(named|with name)] %string% (with suggestions|using) %objects%
register [optional] %*brigarg% arg[ument] [(named|with name)] %string% with [min %number%] [and] [with] [max %number%]
Description:
Register an argument for a brig command.

Within this section you can apply suggestions with tooltips.
The section itself will run when a player types a command, thus variables CAN be used and the [event-]player
will be the player typing the command.
Local variables will be created for the previously typed args, and can be used in this section. See examples.

`brigarg` = Type of argument. See Brig Argument Type for more details.

`string` = Name of the argument. (Used for local variables and how it shows in game)

`%objects`% = Suggestions for this argument. (If object is not a string, Skript will stringify it)

`min/max` = The min/max range of a number (long/int/float/double) argument.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/ShaneBeee/SkBriggy/releases

ID: 9390
Title: Draw Particle - Skript-Particle
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
draw %customparticles% %directions% %locations% [(for|to) %players%]
Description:
Draws a particle at a location. Syntax inspired by SkBee, so bee careful not to get the two confused.
If you run into conflicts with SkBee, which you shouldn't, please report it immediately.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9391
Title: Rotate Shape
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
rotate shape[s] %shapes% around [(relative|local)] (%vector%|((x|y|z)(-| )axis)) by %number% [degrees|radians]
rotate shape[s] %shapes% (by|with) [rotation] %quaternion%
rotate [drawn] shape[s] around [(relative|local)] (%vector%|((x|y|z)(-| )axis)) by %number% [degrees|radians]
rotate [drawn] shape[s] (by|with) [rotation] %quaternion%
Description:
Rotates shapes around a given axis by a given angle. The axis can be specified as a vector or as a single axis (x, y, or z). By default, the rotation is done in degrees.
The axis can also be specified as a local or relative axis, which rotate relative to the shape's current rotation.
For example, you can rotate a shape around the global y axis, or around the shape's local y axis.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9392
Title: Toggle Axes
Syntax Type: effect
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
(show|hide) [local] [and] [global] axes of [shape[s]] %shapes%
Description:
Toggles the visibility of the local and/or global axes of a shape.
When on, the shape will also draw its local and/or global axes when drawn.
This is intended for debugging purposes.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9393
Title: Drawn Shape
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the] drawn shape
Description:
Returns the shape that is being drawn by the draw section.
Return Type: Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9394
Title: Helix Winding Rate
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the] winding rate of %shapes%
%shapes%'[s] winding rate
Description:
Gets or sets the winding rate of a helix. The winding rate is the number of times the helix wraps around the axis per block.
The default winding rate is 1 loop per block, which delete or reset will set it to. The winding rate must be positive and non-zero.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9395
Title: Last Created Particle
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
last created [custom] particle
Description:
Returns the last particle created with the custom particle section.
Return Type: Custom Particle
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.2
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9396
Title: Normal Vector of Shape
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the] normal [vector] of %shapes%
%shapes%'[s] normal [vector]
Description:
Returns the normal vector of a shape. This, by default, is the vector (0, 1, 0) which points directly up.If the shape is rotated, this will be the vector that is pointing up after the rotation. Treat it as what the shape thinks is "up".
Changing this will rotate the shape accordingly. Resetting or deleting it will set it back to the default orientation.
Return Type: Vector
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9397
Title: Particle Arc or Sector
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a[n]] [circular] (arc|sector) (with|of) radius %number% and [cutoff] angle [of] %number% [degrees|radians]
[a[n]] [cylindrical] (arc|sector) (with|of) radius %number%(,| and) height %number%[,] and [cutoff] angle [of] %number% [degrees|radians]
Description:
Creates an arc or sector with the given radius and cutoff angle. The radius must be greater than 0 and the height, if given, must be positive.
The angle must be between 0 and 360 degrees. If the angle is 360 degrees, the shape will be a circle or cylinder.
An arc is a portion of the circle's circumference. A sector is a portion of the circle's area.
Return Type: Radial Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9398
Title: Particle Circle or Cylinder
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a] (circle|disc) (with|of) radius %number%
[a] [hollow|solid] (cylinder|tube) (with|of) radius %number% and height %number%
Description:
Creates a circle, disc, or cylinder shape with the given radius. The radius must be greater than 0 and the height cannot be negative.
Return Type: Radial Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9399
Title: Particle Cuboid
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a] [hollow|solid] cuboid (with|of) length %number%(,| and) width %number%[,] and height %number%
[a] [hollow|solid] cuboid (from|between) %location/entity/vector% (to|and) %location/entity/vector%
Description:
Creates a cuboid from a length, a width, and a height, or from two corners.
The specified length, width, and height must be greater than 0. Length is the x-axis, width is the z-axis, and height is the y-axis.
When defining a cuboid from two corners, the corners can either be vectors or locations/entities. You cannot use both vectors and locations/entities, but you can mix and match locations and entities.When using locations, this is a shape that can be drawn without a specific location. It will be drawn between the two given locations.
Return Type: Length/Width/Height Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9400
Title: Particle Ellipse or Elliptical Cylinder
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a[n]] [(solid|filled)] (ellipse|oval) (with|of) radi(i|us) %number% and %number%
[a[n]] [hollow|solid] elliptical (cylinder|tube) (with|of) radi(i|us) %number%(,| and) %number%[,] and height %number%
Description:
Creates a ellipse, elliptical disc, or elliptical cylinder shape with the given radii. The radii must be greater than 0.
The first radius is the x radius, and the second radius is the z radius. These are relative to the shape's rotation, so they only correspond exactly to the x and z axes if the shape is not rotated.
NOTE: Very eccentric elliptical discs/sectors (those with a large difference between the x and z radii) may have many more particles than expected. Be careful.
Return Type: Length/Width/Height Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9401
Title: Particle Ellipsoid
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a[n]] [(outlined|wireframe|hollow|(solid|filled))] ellipsoid (with|of) radi(i|us) %number%(,| and) %number%[,] and %number%
Description:
Creates a ellipsoid shape with the given radii. The radii must be greater than 0.
The first radius is the x radius, and the second is the y radius, and the last is the z radius. These are relative to the shape's rotation, so they only correspond exactly to the world axes if the shape is not rotated.
Note that this shape is modified using the Length/Width/Height modifiers, not the Radius modifier. This means the length/width/height of the shape will be twice the radius in each direction. Length is the x axis, width is the z axis, and height is the y axis.
NOTE: Very eccentric solid ellipsoids (those with a large difference between the radii) may have many more particles than expected. Be careful.
Return Type: Length/Width/Height Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9402
Title: Particle Elliptical Arc or Sector
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[an] elliptical (arc|sector) (with|of) radi(i|us) %number%(,| and) %number%[,] and [cutoff] angle [of] %number% [degrees|radians]
[an] elliptical [cylindrical] (arc|sector) (with|of) radi(i|us) %number%(,| and) %number%(,| and) height %number%[,] and [cutoff] angle [of] %number% [degrees|radians]
Description:
Creates an elliptical arc or sector with the given radii and cutoff angle. The radii must be greater than 0 and the height, if given, must be positive.
The angle must be between 0 and 360 degrees. If the angle is 360 degrees, the shape will be a ellipse or elliptical cylinder.
An arc is a portion of the ellipse's circumference. A sector is a portion of the ellipse's area.
NOTE: Very eccentric elliptical sectors (those with a large difference between the x and z radii) may have many more particles than expected. Be careful.
Return Type: Length/Width/Height Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9403
Title: Particle Heart
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a] [solid] heart [shape] (with|of) width %number%[,] [and] length %number%[[,] [and] eccentricity %number%]
Description:
Creates a heart shape with the given width and height, and optionally eccentricity. The width (x) and length (z) must be greater than 0.
The eccentricity defaults to 3, but must be at least 1. This determines how round/pointy the heart is. Values between 1 and 5 are recommended.
Note that the width and length are not exact, but they're roughly the width and length of the heart.
Finally, this shape does not support the particle count expression and its particle density is not uniform. If anyone knows a good way to compute the complete elliptic integral of the second kind, please let me know.
Return Type: Length/Width/Height Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.1
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9404
Title: Particle Helix / Spiral
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a[n]] [solid] [[(counter|anti)[-]]clockwise] (helix|spiral) (with|of) radius %number%[,] [and] height %number%[[,] [and] winding rate [of] %number% [loops per (meter|block)]]
Description:
Creates a helix or spiral shape with the given radius and height. The radius and height must be greater than 0.
The winding rate is the number of loops per meter or block. If omitted, the winding rate will be 1 loop per block.
The height of the helix can be manipulated through both the length and height expressions.
Return Type: Radial Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9405
Title: Particle Irregular Polygon
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a] [2d] polygon (from|with) [vertices|points] %vectors/locations% [and height %number%]
Description:
Creates an irregular polygon from a list of vectors or locations. If locations are used, the polygon can be drawn without giving a specific location to draw at.
The height of the polygon will be the height between the lowest and highest points. It can also be set with the optional height parameter.

Irregular polygons currently only support the wireframe style. Also, they do not currently support Dynamic Locations like lines and cuboids do.
Return Type: Length/Width/Height Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9406
Title: Particle Line
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a] line[s] (from|between) %locations/entities/vectors% (to|and) %locations/entities/vectors%
[a] line (in [the]|from) direction %vector% [(and|[and] with) length %number%]
[a] line (between|connecting) %locations/entities/vectors%
Description:
Creates a line shape between points, or in a direction for a given length. The length must be greater than 0.
When defining a line from points, the points can either be vectors or locations/entities. Each point in the first set will connect to each point in the second set. You can use the third pattern to connect points in series, like a path along the points.

You cannot use both vectors and locations/entities, but you can mix and match locations and entities.When using locations, this is a shape that can be drawn without a specific location. It will be drawn between the two given locations.
If using vectors, or a direction and length, the shape does require a location to be drawn at.
Return Type: Length/Width/Height Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9407
Title: Particle Rectangle
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a[n]] [(solid|filled)] [xz|xy|yz] rectangle (with|of) length %number% and width %number%
[a[n]] [(solid|filled)] [xz|xy|yz] rectangle (from|with corners [at]) %location/entity/vector% (to|and) %location/entity/vector%
Description:
Creates a rectangle from a length and a width, or from two corners. The length and width must be greater than 0.
When defining a rectangle from two corners, the corners can either be vectors or locations/entities. You cannot use both vectors and locations/entities, but you can mix and match locations and entities. When using locations, this is a shape that can be drawn without a specific location. It will be drawn between the two given locations.
Note that the rectangle defaults to the xz plane, or parallel to the ground, with x being width and z being length. You can change this to the xy or yz plane by using the 'xy' or 'yz'. In all cases, the first axis is length and the second is width.
Return Type: Length/Width/Height Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9408
Title: Particle Regular Polygon
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a] [(solid|filled)] regular polygon with %number% sides and radius %number%
[a] [(solid|filled)] regular polygon with %number% sides and side length %number%
[a[n]] [(solid|filled)] ([equilateral ]triangle|square|pentagon|hexagon|heptagon|octagon) with radius %number%
[a[n]] [(solid|filled)] ([equilateral ]triangle|square|pentagon|hexagon|heptagon|octagon) with side length %number%
Description:
Creates a regular polygon with the given number of sides and radius. The number of sides must be at least 3. The radius must be greater than 0.
Return Type: Radial Shape
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9409
Title: Particle Regular Polyhedron
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a[n]] [outlined|hollow|solid] (tetra|octa|icosa|dodeca)hedron (with|of) radius %number%
Description:
Creates a regular polyhedron shape with the given radius. The radius must be greater than 0.
Valid polyhedra are tetrahedra (4 faces), octahedra (8), dodecahedra (12), and icosahedra (20).

Polyhedra currently do not support the particle count expression, only particle density.
Return Type: Radial Shape
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9410
Title: Particle Sphere
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a] [solid] sphere (with|of) radius %number%
Description:
Creates a sphere shape with the given radius. The radius must be greater than 0.
Default style is a hollow sphere, but you can use the 'solid' tag to make it solid.
Return Type: Radial Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9411
Title: Particle Spherical Cap
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a] spherical (cap|sector) (with|of) radius %number% and [cutoff] angle [of] %number% [degrees|radians]
Description:
Creates a spherical cap or spherical sector shape with the given radius and cutoff angle. The radius must be greater than 0.
The angle must be between 0 and 180 degrees. If the angle is 180 degrees, the shape will be a sphere.
A spherical cap is a portion of the surface of a sphere. A spherical sector, or spherical cone, is essentially a cone with a rounded base.
Return Type: Radial Shape
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9412
Title: Particle Star
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[a] [solid] star with %number% points(,| and) inner radius %number%[,] and outer radius %number%
Description:
Creates a star shape with the given number of points, inner radius, and outer radius. The number of points must be at least 2, and the inner and outer radii must be greater than 0.
Note that "points" in this context is referring to the tips of the star, not the number of particles.
Return Type: Shape
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9413
Title: Particle With Data
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[%number% [of]] %customparticle/particle% particle[s] [using %itemtype/blockdata/dustoption/dusttransition/vibration/number%] [with offset %vector%] [with extra %number%] [with force]
Description:
Creates a particle with data. This is useful for creating particles with data such as dust options, dust transitions, vibrations, etc.
The particle can be created with a particle type, or a custom particle. If a custom particle is used, the particle will be cloned. If a count is not specified, it will default to 1.
This syntax was based on SkBee's draw particle effect syntax, so please report any conflicts with SkBee immediately. There should not be any conflicts, but there's always a risk.
Return Type: Custom Particle
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9414
Title: Rotation
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the|a] rotation (from|around) [the] [vector] %vector% (with|by) [[the|an] angle [of]] %number% [degrees|radians]
[the|a] rotation (from|between) %vector% (to|and) %vector%
Description:
Describes a rotation around a vector by a given angle, or from one vector to another. An alternative to the `axisAngle` and `quaternion` functions. Returns a quaternion.
Return Type: Quaternion
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9415
Title: Shape Copy
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle

[a] shape cop(y|ies) of %shapes%
Description:
Returns a copy of the given shape. This is useful if you want a modified version of a shape without changing the original.

Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9416
Title: Shape Cutoff Angle
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the] cutoff angle of %cutoffshapes%
%cutoffshapes%'[s] cutoff angle
Description:
The cutoff angle of a shape in degrees. This determines the portion of the whole shape that will be drawn in shapes like arcs and spherical caps. For example, a cutoff angle of 90 on an arc will create a quarter of a circle.
Note that an arc can range from 0 to 360 degrees, while a spherical cap can range from 0 to 180 degrees.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9417
Title: Shape Length/Width/Height
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle

[the] shape (length|width|height) of %lwhshapes%
%lwhshapes%'[s] shape (length|width|height)
Description:
The length, width, or height of a shape. Changing this will change the size of the shape. Resetting or deleting it will set it back to the default value of 1.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9418
Title: Shape Locations
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
(particle|point) locations of %shapes% [[centered] %direction% %location%]
Description:
Returns all the locations that particles would be spawned at if the shape was centered at the given location.
If you want the vectors relative to the center of the shape, use the 'shape points' expression.

Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9419
Title: Shape Offset
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the] offset [vector] of %shapes%
%shapes%'[s] offset [vector]
Description:
Returns the offset vector of a shape. This is the vector that is added to the location of the shape before drawing.
Changing this will move the shape accordingly. Resetting or deleting it will set it back to the default offset of (0, 0, 0).
Return Type: Vector
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9420
Title: Shape Orientation
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the] orientation of %shapes%
%shapes%'[s] orientation
Description:
The orientation of a shape. This is the rotation that is applied to the shape before drawing.
Changing this will rotate the shape accordingly. Resetting or deleting it will set it back to the default orientation of (0, 0, 0, 1).
The expression returns a quaternion. You can use the quaternion and axis angle functions or the rotation expression to create an orientation.
Return Type: Quaternion
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9421
Title: Shape Particle
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the] [custom] particle of %shapes%
%shapes%'[s] [custom] particle
Description:
The particle of a shape. This is the particle that the shape uses to draw itself.
Changing this will change the particle of the shape. Resetting or deleting it will set it back to the default particle (flame).
You can set the particle to any base or custom particle.
Return Type: Custom Particle
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9422
Title: Shape Particle Density / Particle Count
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the] particle (density|count) of %shapes%
%shapes%'[s] particle (density|count)
Description:
The density at which particles are spawned in a shape. This is in "particles per meter" (ppm), and defaults to 4.Be careful with this property, as it can cause lag if set to a high number. It's recommended to not go above 20 or so for this reason. 1000 ppm is the maximum value.
Keep in mind that this value scales with dimensions. A 1 meter line with a density of 20 will spawn 20 particles, but a 1 meter cube with a density of 20 will spawn 8,000 particles (2,400 if hollow).
Also, be aware that this may not be exact. Some shapes, like cuboids, will tweak the density a bit to ensure particles land exactly on the borders of the shape.

This syntax also supports setting the particle count directly, which is the amount of particles spawned in a shape.
Note that this is NOT exact. The actual amount of particles spawned will be the closest multiple of the particle count to the amount of particles needed to draw the shape.
For example, if the particle count of a solid cube is set to 100, the actual amount of particles spawned will be 125, which is the nearest cubic number.
The returned value of this expression will always be the accurate amount of particles spawned in a shape.

Changing this will change the particle density or count of the shape. Resetting or deleting it will set it back to the default density (4).
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9423

Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the] points of %shapes%
%shapes%'[s] points
Description:
Returns all the vectors from the center of the shape to the various points particles would be drawn at.
If you want the locations of the particles, it's advised use the 'shape locations' expression rather than doing it yourself.
Return Type: Vector
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9424

%radialshapes%'[s] radius
Description:
The radius of a shape. For circular or spherical shapes, this is the distance from the center to the edge. For shapes like regular polygons, this is the distance from the center to a corner.
Changing this will change the size of the shape. Resetting or deleting it will set it back to the default radius of 1.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

Description:
Returns the relative axis of a shape. These are the x, y, z axis of the shape AFTER rotation.
These are meant to be used to work within the rotated frame of reference of the shape.

Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9426

Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the] shape scale of %shapes%
%shapes%'[s] shape scale
Description:
Returns the scale of a shape. This is will scale the shape up or down accordingly, with respect to its center.
This does not affect the number of particles drawn, so a scaled up shape will look more sparse. A negative scale will flip the shape inside-out.
Changing this will scale the shape accordingly. Resetting or deleting it will set it back to the default scale of 1.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9427
Title: Shape Side Count - Polygonal/Polyhedral
Syntax Type: expression
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[the] side(s| count) of %polyshapes%
%polyshapes%'[s] side(s| count)
Description:
Returns the number of sides of a polygonal or polyhedral shape. This determines how many sides the shape has.
Changing this will change the number of sides of the shape accordingly, with a minimum of 3.
Note that custom polygons will return their side count, but will not be affected by this expression. 
Polyhedrons will return their face count, and can only be set to 4, 8, 12, or 20.

Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9428

Description:
Returns the side length of a polygonal/polyhedral shape. This determines how long each side of the shape is.
Changing this will change the side length of the shape accordingly. Likewise, this changes the radius of the shape. Resetting this will set the side length to the default value of 1 and non-positive values will be set to 0.001.
Note that changing this property will not affect custom polygons, only regular polygons and polyhedrons.
Return Type: Number
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9448
Title: Custom Particle Section
Syntax Type: section
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
create [a] [new] custom %particle% [particle] [with]
Description:
This section can be used in conjunction with the `last created particle` expression to create custom particles.
The particle can be any custom particle from skript-particle or from skbee.
Fields include:
	count: integer - the number of particles to create (required)
	offset: vector - the offset value of the particle. See the Minecraft wiki on /particle for more info. (default: 0, 0, 0)
	velocity: vector - the velocity of the particle. Can be a vector or a motion (inwards/clockwise/etc.). (default: 0, 0, 0)
	extra: number - the extra value of the particle. Forces `count` to be 0 and cannot be combined with `offset`. See the Minecraft wiki on /particle for more info. (default: 0)
	force: boolean - whether or not to force the particle to be seen at long range. (default: false)
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.2
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest

ID: 9449
Title: Draw Shape
Syntax Type: section
Addon: Skript-Particle
Syntax Pattern:
[sync[hronously]] draw [the] shape[s] [of] %shapes% [%directions% %locations/entities%] [to %players%]
draw [the] shape[s] [of] %shapes% [%directions% %locations/entities%] [to %players%] (for) [duration] %timespan% [with (delay|refresh [rate]) [of] %timespan%]
Description:
Draws the given shapes at the given locations. The shapes will be drawn in the order they are given.
The code inside the draw shape section will be executed before drawing begins. You can use `event-shape` or `drawn shape` to get the shape being drawn. Modifying this shape affects the end result, but it does not modify the original shape! This means you can set particle data, or change the shape's location, rotation, or scale, without affecting the shape the next time it's drawn.
**Note that this means the section is run once for each shape!** This is the same way the spawn section works in Skript. This is subject to change if people find it cumbersome.

By default, this effect will run asynchronously, meaning it will do all the calculation and drawing on a separate thread, instead of blocking your server's main thread. This is much better if you want to draw a lot of shapes at once, or if you want to draw large and complex shapes.
Be aware that this changes the behavior of the section slightly. All the section code will first be executed synchronously, and then the drawing will be done asynchronously. This means that the time the shape appears may be slightly delayed compared to the completion of the section code.
Additionally, the code immediately after the draw shape section will be executed immediately, often before the drawing is finished. If you stumble across issues with this, please report them on the Skript-Particles GitHub page and use the synchronous option instead.

Drawing a shape for a duration is async only.
Compatible Addon Version: 1.0.0
Addon Link: https://github.com/sovdeeth/skript-particle/releases/latest
